author: {'steamid': '76561198005955224', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1524738887}
review:
Weird game.
Solve the same puzzles for hours. Oh and hurry. There's a 'beat a game in 3 hours' achievement.
By the end of a game I got so dumb doing the same things so the very last puzzle of a [spoiler] drop a key in a spiky pipe[/spoiler] was solved only searching online. Cherry on top. Cool rewarding feelings. :-\
Some checkpoint bug threw me away without my car to a 'proceed in car only' place. Restart.
Want a perfect game? Unlock all the extras. Go search for every single gem. Watch it checking another fork on your road cause most likely you won't be allowed to come back. As a reward - devs photos. Bikini girls, I assume.
Barely made it for the first time. Two more to go. Scavenge run and speed run. I know it's gonna hurt.
Still, I don't give a beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052733586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1523925576}
review:
[b] Stealing an idea I saw done here to help me get through my huge backlog of games on Steam. It is what I like to call my "1 Hour Playtime Reviews Because My Steam Library Has Gotten Stupid Big and I Don't Want to Regret How I Spend My Money Challenge." [/b] 

Beatbuddy is a music centric action 2D adventure game where the entire game takes place in everyones favorite style within the platforming genre. Underwater! 

Yes, yes, typically underwater controls leave a lot to be desired, but here, it all fits in an overall fun game with bouncy characters and chuckle worthy dialogue. There is a lot of charm here and I especially got a kick out of the music and how it played with level design. Also, as a long time fan of Parov Stelar's work, I was quite happy to his music in the first level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1523217924}
review:
8.4.2018. Game #31

[h1] I really thought I was going to love this game... [/h1]

I took one good look at this game and I said to myself: “I’m going to have a good time with this game” and I did, during the first level… and after that first level I couldn’t have been happier when I saw those credits roll.

[h1] So, Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians? Sounds epic right? [/h1]

Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians is basically a swimming simulator with a few puzzles along the way and a neat twist that, unfortunately, gets old really fast. You play as the game as Beatbuddy, a cute little humanoid blob who is one of the three guardians of Symphonia (an underwater kingdom). Symphonia is, apparently, powered by music and music is generated through the three guardians who are always sleeping and dreaming of it. So after beatbuddy gets awoken by his sister, it’s clear that trouble is afoot. 

[h1] For a guardian, Beatbuddy sure doesn't look all that powerful [/h1]

While being a guardian of an underwater kingdom sounds like a powerful title, Beatbuddy sure doesn’t feel like a powerful guardian. In fact, he feels like a regular resident of symphony. Using his “powers”, beatbuddy must find what is causing a disturbance in the music, fix it and go back to sleep with his siblings, or at least, that’s how I understood the story. It’s not told very well. It starts well enough where you get this German-ish narrator who starts telling the lore and after a few lines, he goes quiet until the very end of the game, where he delivers the closing lines. What happened there? 

[h1] Easy controls and cute graphics [/h1]

The game looks pretty with its cartoon graphics. The controls are very easy to learn too. All you need is your mouse and occasionally the space key.

[h1] What do fish do? [/h1]

So, what is the gameplay like? Well, you control Beatbuddy with your mouse and you are trying to get from point A to point B through a 2D underwater levels. Like I said above, Beatbuddy can’t do much but swim and maybe dash. Later in the game, he learns how to attack but it barely feels like a power up since it doesn’t add much to the game. So what you do is, just like Dory from Finding Nemo says “Just keep swimming, just keep swimming”.

[h1] Move to the beat with some awesome tunes [/h1]

The neat twist this game has it the music. Every stage has a different song and the each level pretty much plays the song. So at first, you will only hear the most basic melody but then you will discover jump pads that add their own sounds to the song you are listening to, which enhances it. As you discover more things in the world, the song gets better. By the time I finished level 1 I was blown away. The level started with a catchy theme but as I kept going and finding things like crabs, jump pads, lasers and other stuff, the song kept getting more instruments and sounds. It’s truly a marvel. This is the case in each level too. The developers seem to be rather proud of their music as, even at the pause screen, you get the link to buy their soundtrack.

Unfortunately, having good music that improves as you keep going through the level is the only redeeming quality I found about beatbuddy. As much as I loved the first level, it because clear very soon that this was the only good thing the game has going for it. 

[h1] Music alone isn't enough to justify such a boring game [/h1]

Music aside, this game is just boring. You swim around, sometimes you solve a very basic puzzle, every other chapter you drive a submarine and the levels all look the same. The game never makes any daring attempts to spice up the gameplay and plays it very safe until the very end. Yes sure, you listen to some catchy tunes but they really don’t make up for the not so innovative gameplay.

Luckily, the game is kind of short. I managed to beat it in just under 5 hours but it’s possible to beat it in less than 3. Other than that, you have some gems that you can collect which unlock pictures of the developers goofing around in their office.

[h1] The music is nice but the game is boring [/h1]

My final rating: don’t play this game. Buy the soundtrack and play it while playing a better game that doesn’t have great music.

Next game: The Beginners Guide
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/303210/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. I’m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1394153415}
review:
Eh, I dunno. This game's just kind of rubbish. The narrator is kind of annoying and I just didn't have very much fun playing it. I tried playing a few levels and it just really didn't click for me, in many ways this feels like a Flash game or something. It's not really a great looking game, and the gameplay never really excited me.

This is just a game that, you'd only play if you had nothing else to play, I think. The gaming market is just so saturated that little guys like this unfortunately barely come up on my radar because they're so small and in this case, not terribly exciting or fresh.

I'd rather just play like, ikachan or something. Now, that's a cute little fun game that's engaging and you don't even have to pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011816621', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1647164667}
review:
Beatbuddy is simply a little feel-good game. It's not that common that I like coming back to a game after a little break, but especially the music gave me fun and other positive feelings while playing so I looked foraward to finishing it. The fact that everything is a music based is a neat direction and I adore the art overall.

From my personal experience it's pretty forgiving and you actually don't need do be THAT rhythmic. It took a bit of time until I "got" the controls which is a bit rhythm based in some situations. Sometimes you fight things. It's pretty simple in a way that you just have to have some timing.

It was a couple times in bundles (I got it in one some years ago), but you can also get it for less than 2€ in a deal. I would say it's definitely worth it, if you like the music and the puzzles. 

Also the game worked flawlessly on Linux! yay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025295316', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1509822913}
review:
I feel kinda bad not recommending this game after completing 90% of the game. 

In this game you are some kind of musical thing that lives in a musical subterranean world where the prince is ruining things and kidnapping your musical sisters. By moving through stupid maps and completing boring and frustrating puzzles, you must save them. 

The worst thing is that, actually, the game starts being really funny and it could be a great platformer... However, 
 there are several reasons wich makes the game a 'meh' one. The most important ones, in my opinion:

* It sells itself as a 'musical platform' however rhythm doesn't have any kind of prominence.

* Controls are **NOT** responsive. It feels clunky and you'll die a lot of times because the response is slow and/or wrong. At least with mouse.

* It's repetitive. Despide the timing puzzle I can't pass, the rest of the game is basically the same puzzles over and over, being difficult by adding more frustrating elements, not clever ones. The game has a feeling of progress by "cheating" with more elements that will kill you thanks to the clumsy control of the thingy.


4/10 or something like that

C'est magnifique, c'est hyper simple, c'est fun.
C'est tellement agréable qu'on ne voit pas le temps passer. Et rarement la musique d'un jeu n'aura été aussi bien intégrée.

review:

- beat based movement is way too annoying and cumbersome,
 just leave  me to go already, i have faster reactions
and button presses than this beat

- the constant zoom in and out
without player controlling it is horrible

- the scenery constantly getting in my way obstructing my vision,
 this is a side scroller but if i put myself into the character i
would be able to see forward and the sides, it's just unreal

- sometimes everything is falling apart and you are rushed this is
heavily forced upon the player at the end, suddenly gets harder
and the mechanics are interfering

- constant game breaking bugs at each chapter, have to restart
each time, i just stopped playing this game after each hour or two
because it got way too annoying to just start over because the game
suddenly stopped all the mechanics and you can't advance,
the game is effectively broken

- the annoying amateur beatboxing and half voice acted normally
half just gibberish is unacceptable, i stopped all the music and
sounds effectively rendering the mechanics of the beat based
gameplay useless, just played the game as a platformer and got
annoyed because the buttons didn't work when i pushed them,
the game started to feel as a bad platformer

- puzzles are very boring after a couple of hours, same ones
over and over, also carrying the keys from A to B on a timer and
sometimes because of the checkpoints the game gets you stuck
making you unable to get to the key again or unable to go back to
the point to bring the key so again restarting the chapter

- the music of the game reminded me when i was little i played
with a program called Dance eJay, just a fun music
making program but pretty generic sounds and music unless
you made your own samples, this game soundtrack is very generic

Note; it would be very hard to make the achievements for the
secrets that i haven't even found one and the completing of the
game under 3 hours would be horrible because of the chapter
bugs that would make you constantly restart them.

3/10 rating. Avoid this game even on a discount, unless they fix the
bugs, witch they won't because it's too old and they don't care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063256789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1504097560}
review:
Запустил игру, освоился с началом. Встретил главного персонажа, летающего в музыкальных водных просторах, малыша Бит. Порадовался нарисованым фонам и уровням, всё весьма красиво глазу.
Главной задачей было, ловить музыкальный бит вместе с героем, проходить уровни и слушать музыку,поэтому на  радостях, скачал в машину Parov Stelar, слушал месяц пока не надоело.

Вернулся в игру, и потерял уже первоначальный интерес.
Однотипные варианты решений головоломок.
Новый уровень уже не отличался от предыдущего, второсортный сюжет не захватил с самого начала, и даже ближе к середине и в целом тоже.

Однако, игра старалась из-за всех сил, весёлые названия персонажей, и даже вроде как забавные стражники, отдающие шутки по тому или иному поводу.
Но калыхаться по уровням, типо отпрыгни, пригнись, пробеги, быстрее быстрее и ещё быстрее пробегай уровень, потому что за вами гонится гигантский червь, а потом вам предлагается моментально расслабиться и решить не сложную задачку с перетаскиванием вещей и ломанием стен, и вновь движемся к новой цели.

Даже багги Мобиль не разукрасил мне время.

Рекомендую игру, хотя бы за то, что в ней можно постараться убить пару часов времени, с интересом или без, это уже вам решать на свой вкус.
Мне лично, было скучно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182092421', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1505456145}
review:
一个标准的节奏游戏，美术很精致，音乐虽然不是那么神，但却非常适宜，听着BGM可以很容易的将自己代入进去，这在节奏游戏中是非常重要的一点。玩的时候手指和身体都不由自主的跟着节拍动了起来，感觉已经进入了人机合一的境界hhh。
前两大关略微有点无聊，从第三关开始越玩越停不下来，用手柄玩手感特别棒，打算一周目随便玩玩体验游戏，二周目再来个全收集。看到很多人的评测说这个游戏不好玩，可能这个游戏比较对我的胃口吧。建议入手前先下载试玩版看看。
个人评分9/10。
扣一分在boss追逐关的bug上。被boss追的时候，如果没跟上节奏落到了镜头外面，而又恰好卡在了一个boss碰不到的位置，这时不会自动判定死亡，镜头还会一直往前走，只能返回上一个检查点重来。

author: {'steamid': '76561197978795694', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1502919148}
review:
Great arts and animations, solid gameplay with clever and never frustrating puzzles and funny action and time challenges and an outstanding OST, Beatbuddy is an indie game project who deserved many prizes and should be a good example for every newbie game developer. I loved that they put a short dev diary in the extras.

Only things that ruined me the magic were two gamebreaking bugs which made me restart the level and a bit of frustrations in "driving" sections due to not so great controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979812270', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1527254916}
review:
[h1]Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians[/h1]

Drei Hamburger Studenten gründen die Indieschmiede Threaks und veröffentlichen 2013 auf Steam Beatbuddy Tale of the Guardians. Das Spiel ist eine äußerst gelungene Mischung aus Rythmus, Action und Puzzle Plattformer.

[h1]Story[/h1]

Die Geschichte ist schnell erzählt. Es gibt unsere Spielfigur, den Beatbuddy, der im Unterwasser Reich Synfonia ein chilliges Leben zwischen Wasserbläschen, Krabben und Pflanzen zu führen scheint. Alles in Synfonia bewegt sich im Rythmus zur Musik und das ist natürlich elektronische Musik. Irgendwie fühlt es sich an, als wäre man in der Repeat-Schleife eines Disney Kino Titels gefangen. Alles, wirklich alles, hat den Beat in Synfonia. Jedes Objekt verursacht irgend einen Ton oder eine Melodie und alles zusammen ergibt die Musik. Aber eines Tages taucht ein Bösewicht auf, der alle nach seinen Bongos tanzen lassen will. Das wollen sich Beatbuddy und seine Freunde natürlich nicht gefallen lassen und so planen sie den Bösewicht zu sabotieren und seine Pläne zu vereiteln.

Sonderlich viel Tiefgang ist hier nicht zu erwarten, aber wer würde einem Comic-Heftchen schon vorwerfen wollen, dass es ihm an und Bedeutsamkeit fehlt? Beatbuddy ist ein Spiel für Gelegenheitsspieler und die Zielgruppe sind eindeutig eher Kinder und Jugendliche. Einmal abgesehen davon ist das Spiel im Wesentlichen ein Plattformer und seit wann müssen die unbedingt eine sensationelle Story haben? Die Geschichte ist kindgerecht und einigermaßen witzig und charmant vorgetragen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Das Gameplay in Beatbuddy Tale of the Guardians ist ein wenig speziell. Zunächst einmal befinden wir uns unter Wasser und die Steuerung ist bewusst ein wenig schwammig und träge, weil so ähnlich würde man Bewegungen unter Wasser auch erwarten. Wer sich hier über eine schwammige Steuerung beschwert, hat irgendwie nicht kapiert, was das Spiel abzubilden versucht. Nachdem man sich nach einer Weile an die Steuerung gewöhnt hat und mehr oder weniger ziellos durch die Level schwimmt, beginnt man ganz unweigerlich auch die Spielfigur im Rythmus der Musik zu bewegen. Das Spiel selbst begünstigt das, denn alles in Synfonia ist irgendwie leichter, wenn man es im richtigen Rythmus tut und unter Wasser kommt man am besten vorwärts, wenn man auf den Beat der Basedrum hört. Das weiß doch jedes Kind.

Wer Musik im Blut hat, dem wird dieses Spiel zufliegen. Wenn man auf die Musik hört, spielt es sich über weite Strecken wie von selbst. Ein paar vereinzelte Puzzle oder auch der ein oder andere etwas größer geratene Levelabschnitt können erstmal verwirrend erscheinen, letztlich überfordert einen Beatbuddy aber ganz sicher nicht, denn die Lösungen sind immer reichlich offensichtlich.

[h1]Grafik & Sound[/h1]

Sowohl die handgezeichneten und oft ziemlich bunten Levelhintergründe, als auch die Spielfiguren und Objekte im Spiel sind wirklich schön geworden. Für mein Empfinden passt hier alles wunderbar zusammen.

Der Soundtrack ist eine klangvolle Reise durch das eher unbekannte Genre des Elektro Swing (& Funk). Hier kann Beatbuddy ganz groß auftrumpfen. Verblüffender Weise ist es den Entwicklern sogar gelungen, Parov Stelar, den Gottvater des Elektro Swing, für ihr Spiel zu begeistern und er hat direkt den Track für den ersten Level geliefert. Hut ab, hier kann man nicht nur ein ausgezeichnetes Gespür für Musik erkennen, sondern offenbar auch ein gutes Händchen beim Verhandeln mit Musikern.

[h1]Kritik[/h1]

An einem Indie Titel rumzunörgeln ist immer leicht. Solche Spiele sollte man nicht mit Triple-A Titeln vergleichen. Innerhalb seiner Möglichkeiten hat Beatbuddy wirklich ganze Arbeit geleistet und so will ich mich mit meiner Kritk auch mal ein wenig zurückhalten.

Über mehr als einen Schwierigkeitsgrad hätte mich schon gefreut, denn das ist die offensichtlichste Schwachstelle dieses Spiels. Mir war es ein wenig zu einfach und so manchem unmusikalischen Grundschüler oder Puzzle Anfänger ist es vielleicht zu schwer. Auch der Wiederspielwert ist für mich ohne weitere Schwierigkeitsgrade so gut wie nicht vorhanden. Ein bißchen schade, denn so hätte man mit vergleichsweise wenig Aufwand deutlich mehr Spieler erreichen können, als mit dem Spinn-Off DLC "Beatbuddy on Tour", das ich komplett überflüssig finde.

Beatbuddy ist überraschend leistungshungrig. Das müsste vermutlich nicht sein. Mit einer etwas besseren Programmierung wäre das bestimmt zu vermeiden gewesen.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]

Beatbuddy Tale of the Guardians ist ein Nischenspiel, das ich nicht unbedingt jedem empfehlen würde. Man sollte für das Genre Elekrto Swing oder elektronische Musik ganz generell empfänglich sein. Den Soundtrack findet man leicht auf youtube und ähnlichen Internet Seiten. Hört also ruhig mal rein, bevor ihr das Spiel kauft.

Man sollte auch etwas für leichte Puzzleplattformer übrig haben, denn wer nur besonders schwere Spiele wie Flame Over und Geometry Dash mag, wird sich hier drei bis vier Stunden lang zu Tode langweilen.

Ich liebe diesen Soundtrack und so fällt es mir nicht schwer zu sagen, dass mir Beatbuddy großen Spaß gemacht hat. Die Art und Weise wie hier Musikspiel und Puzzle Plattformer mit einer Unterwasserwelt verbunden wurden, ist ganz sicher etwas Besonderes. Ein Spiel wie Beatbuddy gibt es kein zweites mal und allein das ist schon ein gutes Kaufargument. Nachdem ich es mehr oder weniger am Stück durchgespielt habe, habe ich es ohne zu zögern in die Liste meiner Indie Favoriten aufgenommen. 

Am meisten Spaß dürfte jedoch die Zielgruppe der 5-12 Jährigen haben, denen man das Spiel mit gutem Gewissen schenken kann. Im Sale bekommt man es übrigens für unter zwei Euro. Beatbuddy ist ganz klar ein Geheimtipp für große und kleine Musikliebhaber. Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985754629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1499176615}
review:
I wouldn't recommend this game even for the low price of 1,79€ as it's priced during this steam sale (2017). I got this game in a humble bundle for years ago but couldn't get myself to finish it until now for several reasons

Firstly, the good parts: The soundtrack. It's excellent, no doubt about it. Also the game got some rather nice backgorunds and coloring for the most part, The humor kind of works for the most parts and the "sound" the characters does is charming. The story serves it's purpose but not much beyond that. Everything else is a mess with this game.

Now for the bad parts: It got some real serious bugs. I had to restart chapters 4 times because some objects in the world wouldn't allow me to interact with it thus making me stuck. 3 of these instances happened during the last 2 chapters of the game. Also, sometimes the music wouldn't load which is kind of damning in a game which requires you to time dodges and attack with the music. 

The game have a tendency to introduce a mechanic and then repeat it and puzzles involving this mechanic for far to long which makes the mechanic overstay it's welcome and starts feeling rather tedious quickly, especially since the level designers never really plays around with it enough to make it very complicated. Also, the level layouts can be maze-like and very confusing from time to time.

The controls just doesn't feel good. It often feels like you have no real control over where you'll appear when you dodge and if a enemy (or you) will register a hit. I'm not sure if it's intentional or not, but also you'll later get a power-up that is for some strange reason bound to the same key as your attack which is annoying. The game claims that you can rebind your buttons but it wouldn't let me when I tried. Not sure if that's a problem with the game or with my gamepad setup though.

If you have any passing intrest of this game, I'd recommend you to buy the soundtrack and leave the game to the sidelines.

review:
A fun, light-hearted game with a great concept. It's an easy game that can be a little frustrating at times. The visual design is great, the sound design is even better. 

Pros: Great soundtrack, visuals are great, easy to learn

Cons: A very easy game but can be very frustrating at times which leads me to my biggest issue of the game. Clunky controls, the responsiveness when clicking in directions takes a lot getting used to and the character doesn't seem to respond quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039405652', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1497471806}
review:
A fun short game where the funky and catchy music makes it all the more enjoyable. 

What I liked about the game was that although a level is about 30 minutes long, it is divided into 5 checkpoint sections. You start off swimming around as your main character, but every other checkpoint you get to swim with an awesome vehicle that shoots and automatically regenerates health. This change of pace every two checkpoints keeps the game from feeling samey. I actually enjoyed these sections the most.

Another great thing are the collectibles. In your adventures you collect crystals to unlock pictures about the development of the game. Normally I don't care much for concept art, but this game shows quirky pictures of the development team with funny captions and a bit of an insight in the development of the game. I really enjoyed these. 

I also really liked the hand-drawn art-style the game had to offer. However, at times it was a little bit hard to see if a section was actually passable or a wall. This is just a slight annoyance, but to me it was worth it for such a great style. 

My favourite thing however, has to be the music. Every time I finished a level, I thought to myself: let's play something else. That was until I heard the music of the next level and decided to stay and play another one. The catchy guitars, amazing singing and grooving beats kept me nodding with my head almost the entire playthrough. The fact that different creatures add different sounds to the music is an amazing touch. 

Negatives: At times, the control of the character felt a little bit too slow and unresponsive for me, especially when I used the "run" (or in the case of this game: swim faster) button. There weren't many spaces where I felt I could utilize this skill. However, when there are timers in the game, they are forgiving and you do not need precision swimming to get through most of the levels. The dash ability that you get usually gives you enough speed to make it to certain points in time, and the "run" skill is therefor not needed to finish the game. 

Another thing that bugged me was that sometimes it was unclear if a path was a secret path with gems or a path to the next goal. This sometimes led to points where I realised I missed a secret, but was unable to go back and get it. It felt unfair that I had seen the path, but that it locked me out of that path for taking the "wrong" route. I guess this adds replayability, but I don't care much for it.

Overall I would say it is worth playing even if for the music alone! If you like funky, groovy music mixed with a little techno, this game is for you. Also, if you like an easy-going, casual side-scroller where you can just enjoy the surroundings and play through without too much effort, you'll like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135104', 'num_games_owned': 3451, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1484972389}
review:
[h1]el océano se descubre al ritmo del bit[/h1]

Beatbuddy es uno de esos juegos que intimidan por la cantidad de menciones y premios que luego presumen en la portada. Respiré profundamente y decidí esperar lo mejor; estos juegos indie, algunas veces, se destacan por ser más bonitos o aspirar a romper ciertos límites narrativos antes que… no sé, jugarse bien. No es el caso de Beatbuddy. Afortunadamente hay un juego sólido e interesante detrás de la música y de las gráficas.

Supongo que el videojuego también inspirado en Ecco (habría que estudiar cuántos son hijos del delfín) porque todo ocurre en el mar y en estas plataformas, en vez de correr, te toca nadar. Beatbuddy presenta la historia de unos espíritus acuáticos que son los guardianes de la música y de algún océano. Tu papel es explorar varios mundos acuáticos al ritmo de música electrónica y en el camino recuperar algún artefacto para restaurar el balance. Típico pero chingón. La música, como lo promete el juego, es sabrosísima y el progreso afecta su ritmo; surgen los instrumentos y su beat acelera conforme avanzas.

Las gráficas tienen un estilo caricaturizado de alta resolución y calidad. Cada escena (personaje, fondo y enemigos) parece una caricatura que verías en MTV de los ochenta (muy ad hoc con el tema musical del juego). Es muy guapo apreciar cómo se mueven los villanos al ritmo de la música, y ello parece una invitación al jugador a incorporarse dentro del ritmo. Predomina cierta intención de evitar a los enemigos, bailar con ellos, en vez de la destrucción (ojo: el juego sí tiene sus pedazos de destrucción, aislados, pero los tiene). Beatbuddy también consta de algunos acertijos de velocidad y movimiento los cuáles, bueno, pueden tomar un par de intentos y podrían interrumpir el flujo, pero nada grave.

¿Recomiendo Beatbuddy? Simón, es un juego hermosamente detallado y su vida musical es pura gozadera. No tiene una gran historia, algunos diálogos están chafones, pero querrás explorar su fascinante mundo acuático y sus escenarios estridentes.

==

Si gustas, puedes leer [url=http://www.agustinfest.com/tema/los-gustos/de-videojuegos/]más reseñas de videojuegos[/url] en mi página personal. O bien, únete a mi [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/arbol1000]grupo de Steam[/url] donde aviso de estas reseñas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015325841', 'num_games_owned': 1304, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1492283713}
review:
Nice artwork, environment and enemies animations fitting the beat, enjoyable music but...
The problem is repetitive gameplay and level design (it is boring after awhile).

author: {'steamid': '76561197961939437', 'num_games_owned': 1758, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1430285028}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062487234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1490556021}
review: Great puzzle game with a bit of a music game added in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080798463', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1465781401}
review:
Beatbuddy kann ich nur eingeschränkt empfehlen. Die Idee ist großartig! Eine Welt, die aus Musik besteht und in der alles mit dieser Musik interagiert. Von der Bewegung der Figuren, bis zum lösen von Rätseln, alles ist rythmisch. Das Design der Spielwelt ist wunderschön, vor allem die Hintergründe sind aufwendig gestalltet.
Doch das Spiel hat mit Schwierigkeiten zu kämpfen. Die Story ist äußerst klischeehaft, die Rätsel sind manchmal sehr simpel und manchmal frustrierend schwer. Vor allem die Tatsche, dass die Checkpoints unfair verteilt sind, und das Spiel schnell monoton wird, machen es schwer mit Beatbuddy über längere Zeit Spaß zu haben.
Wer auf der Suche nach einem rythmischen Spiel für zwischendurch ist, wird mit Beatbuddy seinen Spaß haben. Wer aber motivierendes Gameplay sucht, wird hier enttäuscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1490527059}
review:
Данная игра позиционирует себя как якобы ритм-игра. На самом же деле, в игровой механике завязки на ритм и музыку практически никакой и нет.

Сама игра однообразная, задачи очень простые, умереть практически нереально, ибо каждые пять метров разбросаны восполнители здоровья. К плюсам можно отнести, разве что, красивую рисовку. Очевидно, что этого недостаточно чтобы вытянуть абсолютно пустую, во всех остальных аспектах, игру.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198054699161', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1488109631}
review:
Cute little game, with interesting game mechanic. It took me around 5-6 hours to finish first time.

Pros:
+ Everything moves according to music beats
+ Good soundtrack, which is extremely important for this type of game
+ Good graphics
+ Fluid commands

Cons:
- Simple, at times tedious, puzzles
- Becomes repetitive, needs better level design to keep ti fresh longer
- Anticlimactic ending

I would recommend this game, especially to some younger audience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149792621', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1487990059}
review: A beautiful game with a great soundtrack (Which all good music based games should have!). A little challenging for those who aren't good at keeping a rhythm (aka, me). Otherwise, a pretty good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134708941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1487811626}
review:
Милая и забавная игра с красивой графикой и чудесным саундтреком.
Мы играем за эфирное создание по имени Beatbuddy (или как его локализовали в описании - Ритмобрат), которое мирно живет себе в стране музыки Симфонии. Все бы хорошо,  если бы злой принц Маэстро не вздумал прибрать всю музыку к своим рукам. Его коварный план включает в себя похищение Гармонии и диктатуру своей собственной музыки.
Разумеется, Beatbuddy не может допустить такого кошмара и пускается в опасное путешествие.
Геймплейно эта игра представляет собой аркаду. На протяжении шести уровней, разбитых на пять глав каждый, нам предстоит проходить лабиринты решать загадки, сражаться с врагами и даже отбивать ударами ритм. Все четные главы представляют собой покатушки на странном батискафоподобном аппарате с возможностью пострелять. Это позволяет разнообразить и без того, в принципе, нескучную игру.
Но самое главное, самое чудесно и потрясающее здесь - это графика и звук. Все уровни, каждый фон, каждая детаь нарисованы вручную. Смотреть на эту игру одно удовольствие. Яркие, детализированные локации словно затягивают тебя и погружают в атмосферу Симфонии. Немало этому способствует и саундтрек, которые с его неизменными битами и легкими, невесомыми мелодиями. 
Игра довольно проста и идеально подходит, чтобы расслабиться после тяжелого дня.
Однозначно, 9 ритмичных битов из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004707803', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1487538035}
review: Super muzyka, fajna synchronizacja obrazu z dźwiękiem i tyle dobrego. Męczące sterowanie, problemy z obsługą pada, dziwne skoki wydajności (raz 400 klatek, żeby po chwili było 80 - vsync nie działa), nuda rozgrywka. Szkoda bo fajnie się zapowiadało.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005636587', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1486492164}
review: Świetny Action-Adventure ze śliczną grafiką, muzyką i satysfakcjonującą rozgrywką zawierającej elementy eksploracji, prostych zagadek środowiskowych i gry rytmicznej. Miła opowieść dopełniała obrazu tej bardzo odprężającekj gry, w której bywały również chwile pełne emocji i intensywnej akcji. Jeden babolek spowodował, że musiałem restartować rozdział w levelu, ale poza tym - było super! Muzyka z tej gry pozostanie ze mną na zawsze. Polecam! 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1486445610}
review:
I prefer my rhythm games to involve a dance pad so I'll keep this short.

Visually its beautiful. Very much a fan of how it looks.
The music is nice, with an appropriate beat.

The mechanics are fairly straightforward and work well.

If you like rhythm games and appreciate good visuals, then this is worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059330591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1486229035}
review:
Really interesting "musical platformer" game.
The soundtrack is superb, the dialogues blend in perfectly with it (some of them are not words at all, but beatboxes that go along with the music).
Story is nice, simple and interesting, not pretentious at all (unlike some games that try too hard hard in this aspect and end up failing miserably).
Controls are good. On rare occasions t might be a bit difficult to execute some moves, but I found it so rare that I can never say the controls are bad. It plays well both on a keyboard+mouse and on a controller.
Graphics are gorgeous, really well done.
You can see the devs put their heart in this game, everything has that extra tounch on it, like the sounds, graphics and dialogues.

Overall I would give 9/10 to this game, mainly because of the soundtrack and sound effects.

Great game, please give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1647374073}
review:
Es bonito, la música es pegadiza y es corto. Hasta ahí bien, pero rápidamente se vuelve repetitivo, tanto en el gameplay como en la parte artística.

A pesar de ser corto, rápidamente se vuelve tedioso por tener que resolver puzzles muy similares una y otra vez. Aún así, si lo compráis muy rebajado, no está mal.

review: The music is amazing. Graphics are really good as well. The gameplay is rather tedious and I feel as though I am wondering around aimlessly. Perhaps a more linear level design would have made for tighter gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094033276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1484344946}
review:
Beatbuddy is a fun little puzzle game witha  rhythm element. Each of the 6 levels is <1 hour and so a good short experience - Can already see myself going back to this to 100% it and see if maybe there's a speedrtunning community for it.

For a game which is so music lead I personally loved the electronic music - especially worth the Sountrack purchase therefore! Very fun and a good example of an indie game worth a playthrough. I picked this up on sale (as I do most things) and whilst this isn't going to blow your mind - it's certainly a fun experience so worth a sale pick up if maybe not quite recommendable at full price. Despite being a good looking game the feel is very much like a retro game. Definitieyl worth a look if you're a puzzle or rhythm gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077796332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1483934665}
review: Cool game, but somehow still incredibly buggy after 3 years. Have gotten stuck and was forced to restart twice now because the bass stopped beating and all the objects in the level stopped working. I know that the purpose of a game is to waste time, but this is pushing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972266428', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1483600894}
review:
Beautiful game, Beatbuddy's animations are stellar, and the music is amazing.

Unfortunately, Beatbuddy's gameplay is not as great as its aesthetics. It felt like a chore to play. The puzzles were tedious and weren't mentally challenging at all; that's basically the majority of the game (from what I played). The controls on a gamepad are passable, but the movement is floaty and I never felt like I was in total control. The music aspect, while a fun concept, ultimately hindered movement (especially while in control of the submarine), and felt more like a gimmick more than anything else. Timing button presses to move to the beat was rewarding, but often times you went too fast for the camera to catch up, resulting in Beatbuddy hugging the edges of the screen constantly and being unable to see the dangers that lie ahead.

3 hours in, I managed to softlock the game by simply dying. I restarted at a checkpoint, and the bass drum plant that I needed to break a wall to progress wasn't working, and there was no way to backtrack. Even after restarting at the checkpoint several times, the bass drum launcher was still disabled. That was the final nail in the coffin.

It was just boring. I was waiting for some exciting gameplay, but it never clicked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016610531', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1522838822}
review:
This game seemed quite fun and innovative, however after playing it for not very long at all the game crashed - and it crashes every time I started it. 

I don't think I did anything glitchy in the game, and seen as I can play most other games without a hitch I have to concldue that it's probably this game which is the cause of the crash. On that basis, I don' t recommend this game. Apologies that this is more a warning than a review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272592418', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1480004665}
review: Beatbuddy je hra založená na hudbě, většina písniček je dobrých ale je pár které mi dost lezly na nervy, což je celkem zásadní problém. Hra není těžká, dá se dohrát velmi rychle. Kreslená grafika je líbivá a styl jakým postavy mluví je celkem roztomilý. Bohužel jsem nejednou narazil na bug který mi zabránil v postupu, takže jsem celkem dlouho bloudil po úrovni a myslel si že jsem něco minul a až když jsem se díval na internet zjistil jsem že nebyly aktivní odrážeče které aktivní být měly, kompletní restart úrovně to vyřešil. Mechaniky hry ale jinak fungují celkem pěkně. Hlavní problém Beatbuddyho je že je až moc lehký, když jsem někde umřel tak to bylo jenom díky mojí nepozornosti a pak taky samotná délka s tím že nevidím důvod si ho zahrát znovu. Fakt že jsem ho pořídil ve slevě za necelé dvě eura to celkem zlepšuje. Pokud ale máte rádi hudebně založené hry a hledáte něco vyloženě na odreagování na co se nemusíte soustředit a hra bude ve slevě tak si ji nejspíš užijete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128418462', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1637794191}
review: Un gamplay bourré d'idée est diablement efficace! voila ce qu'est beatbuddy! l'univers de la musique prend forme de plein de maniere differente! d'ennemie, de scenario, de perso, d'histoire! cela me rappelle inside my radio mais ici c'est tout une aventure! (apres reste a savoir si elle est integralement sous-marine) c'est prenant et on s'attardera souvent sur le tempo des bruitage qui nous feront danser tous seul comme des kons* x"3 une bonde son original et un rythme qui pousse! j'vous avous que je m'attendais pas a autant venant de ce jeu! une veritable perle que je manquerai pas de faire en let"s play ;3 je le conseille! ps: appeler harmony! on va beat sur le monde la musique XDD

author: {'steamid': '76561198078242064', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1556211824}
review:
Erhielt ich als Random-Key für 2 Euro.
Der Soundtrack swingt und es fällt einem sehr schwer, still zu sitzen und nicht mit zu wippen beim spielen.

Die Grafik und Animationen sind sehr schön gemacht, Gameplay erinnert an die Jump N' Runs aus den 90'ern.

Spaßiges Spiel für zwischendurch, dass Gute Laune macht. Ist seine 9 Euro definitiv wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1482145894}
review:
Wie nennt man denn einen Platformer wo man schwimmt statt hüpft? Schwimformer?
Naja auf jeden Fall ist Beatbuddy so was ähnliches wie ein Platformer nur eben, man schwimmt. Und das ist ziemlich cool gemacht.
Fans von Hardcoreplatformer werden hier enttäuscht, denn der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist moderat und nur ganz gegen Ende gibt es ein paar etwas herausforderndere Stellen, aber auch die sind nach einigen Versuchen und dank der fairen Speicherpunkte gemeistert.
Das Spiel dient mit seiner sanften Herausforderung, der coolen Musik und dem wunderbaren Stil v.a. eine eher relaxteren Partie. Für mich war Beadbuddy ideal zur Entspannung auf dem Sofa. Das heisst nicht, dass es langweilig war, im Gegenteil. Aber eben, es ist auch keines dieser "ich knoble stundenlang an einer Stelle"-Spiele.

Fazit: Wer gemütlich eine Runde zocken möchte zur Erholung ist bei Beatbuddy perfekt aufgehoben.
(Ich war richtig enttäuscht, als das Spiel fertig war, ganz nach dem Motto: Schade, das hätte noch lange so weitergehen dürfen...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167540743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1479671657}
review:
With a brilliant soundtrack and fun characters, I absolutely recommend this game.  Everything in the environments of this game behave in accordance to the beat of the music, and it's executed really well.

The story is fine.  Nothing groundbreaking, but it doesn't need to be.  The writing is still solid, and the puzzles are well crafted and appropriately challenging.  Give this game a shot for something fun and different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068180443', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1455584061}
review:
Music based gameplay really brings it all together. The puzzles are fun and it's not too difficult in my opinion. Of course, as someone who finds Antichamber plausible, my opinion may not be the best. xD

Either way, I would highly reccomend playing this game. You'll love it! 
9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064852407', 'num_games_owned': 1250, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1412983500}
review:
It’s a strange rhythm game. Yep, rhythm is an important key in this game. In the first few level you might be able to brute force it, but then you’ll hit a road block. So enjoy the game and listen to the music. The better you do the more complex and complete the music gets, and what a good music it is.
It’s a good game and a good experience, so give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165236215', 'num_games_owned': 8476, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1473920180}
review:
《Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians/节奏小子：守护者传说》如它封面图上的slogan所说，是一款复古的冒险游戏。游戏是在节奏游戏的基础上加入了冒险和解谜的元素，整体采用了比较传统的固定存档点关卡式解谜机制，从操作上来说使用手柄的体验应该比较好。本作创意不错，感觉开发风格偏学院派一些，游戏没有过大的硬伤，但整体表现中规中矩，也没有特别出彩的亮点。

优点
+BGM不错，适合喜欢节奏感强的音乐的人，节拍也在不同的细节上配合了游戏的进程
+解谜不难，节奏感不差的话不难通关，不是很卡操作
+游戏的手感与BGM配合还不错，踩在拍子上会比较带感

缺点
-过于中规中矩，不论在节奏、关卡、画面还是操作手感方面都只能给7分左右，没有特别优秀的部分，有些可惜了设定
-奖励机制略弱，只能收集水晶用来解锁EXTRA，对于不少追求刺激的玩家来说缺乏爽点
-惩罚的表现力也略弱，玩家撞到会扣血的尖刺之类的东西时会红屏但画面震动很不明显，角色也没有明显的击退一类的动作效果，让人感觉好像轻飘飘就死了，有点失衡

总评：喜欢节奏和传统冒险游戏的玩家可以试试，游戏不差，但远没有达到我打开主菜单时对游戏的心理预期——7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1473215103}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians foi minha maior decepção no steam nesse ultimo mês: jogo variando entre desafiante e divertido na medida certa, boa arte e trilha sonora ótima e mesclando completamente com os elementos do game. Eu realmente estava determinado a terminar o jogo por todos esses aspectos, por isso ignorei alguns bugs nos controles, só que quanto mais me aproximei dos últimos capítulos mais frequente se tornaram os bugs, e maiores também: fui obrigado a reiniciar uma fase porque entrei em uma sala na hora errada (a saída que havia funcionado, simplesmente não funcionava mais) e outra porque morri, meu checkpoint me trouxe de volta, mas antes de eu destrancar o caminho, só que as ferramentas que eu devia usar pra abrir o caminho haviam sumido. E o pior é que esses bugs parecem estar no jogo a muito tempo, os devs nunca arrumaram, isso é frustrante DEMAIS. Por isso minha não recomendação, desisto do jogo, mas desisto triste.
------------------------------------------------------
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians was my biggest disappointment in steam this last month: ranging from challenging to fun just right, good art and great soundtrack that merges completely with the game elements. I was really determined to finish the game by all these aspects, so I ignored some bugs in the controls, only the more I approached the last chapters, most frequent became the bugs, and bigger too: I was forced to restart a stage because I entered a room at the wrong time (the exit that had worked simply no longer worked) and another because I died, my checkpoint brought me back, but before I unlock the way out, only the tools that I must use to open the way had disappeared. And the worst is that these bugs seem to be in the game a long time, the devs never tidied, it is f* frustrating. So there is my "not recommendation", give up the game, but give up sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025571064', 'num_games_owned': 2169, 'num_reviews': 1520, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1561797287}
review:
[h1] Мелодия, Гармония..*глубокий вдох*...Ритм... [/h1]
В первый раз я сталкиваюсь с музыкальной игрой, в которой музыка выступает в качестве элемента геймплея, а не только как фон и усилитель атмосферы. И конечно же в самой игре очень сильные композиции, которые сопровождают вас на протяжении уровня, однако, если задерживаться на уровне больше 40 минут, то уже начинает надоедать, что ещё удивительно, у каждого героя есть своя музыкальная тема, такое я вообще вижу, точнее слышу, впервые, пусть они не сильно интересные, но композиции в некой шуточной форме отражают характеры действующих лиц. Помимо прочего разрабы не поскупились на графику, очень приятная и теплая картинка, изредка можно встретить даже очень крутые [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=751016045] пейзажи  [/url].
Сюжет здесь сказочный и простой, к сожалению, каких-то неожиданных поворотов игра не принесёт. Геймплей хорош, пусть несколько запоздало и скромно, но игра не забывает дарить нам новые фичи и вносит разнообразие, локации тоже не богаты, но этот минус тает в картинке и звуке. Можно конечно пытаться двигаться в ритме, но, как правило, наблюдательность и ловкость решают, впрочем, как и всегда. Сама же игра легкая, простенькие головоломки, всё сделано для того, чтобы вы могли расслабиться, однако пару потных моментов встретится. Неоднократно наблюдались фризы при подгрузке локаций, возможно дело в старом железе.
Никогда не котировал электронную музыку, но в этой игре она мне очень понравилось, думаю вряд ли это поменяет моё мнение в целом, но таким же ненавистникам этого жанра, как я, советую попробовать.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970735557', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1472186562}
review: Now here's a game which is entirely its own thing. It's a bit like Alice: Madness Returns in that it has six very, very long levels which tend to be constructed from a rather small handful of mechanics, but they're all exceptionally pretty, and the game's integration with the music is impressive. By the last level I was tiring a little of the toolbox, but the last level itself has some good twists - sometimes literally - and overall I think it's well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130657097', 'num_games_owned': 1851, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1469273863}
review:
Beatbuddy : Tale of the Guardians.

Beatbuddy : Tale of the guardians is an unremarkable game. A game where the soundtrack seems to be the only saving grace.  Usually, I like games like beatbuddy where there are some good puzzles, an interesting character, a good premise, tight controls and then a fabulous soundtrack to accompany it. But Beatbuddy tries to carry the whole title on the soundtrack. 

Gameplay
You play as Beatbuddy, who awakes from his sleep and then embarks on a quest to save his own immortality and his companions. You move to the sound of the beats that are present in an underwater world. The controls “feel” clunky even though they are not. As beatbuddy moves underwater, you can sense a slow movement scheme where you want to move him faster. The puzzles in the title are fairly easy and present little challenge.  The game is also very repetitive in nature.
Visuals
Beatbuddy : Tale of the guardians features hand painted levels which are gorgeous to look at. Though there isn’t much variety in the environment so after sometime, they begin to look stale. In the start though, it is a joy to transverse through these levels. The level design is pretty decent but not excellent. Overall, in visuals Beatbuddy looks good without having much variety.
Soundtrack
Soundtrack is the meat of the Beatbuddy: Tale of the guardians. The music kicks in depending on the mood and never lets go. As I said, you can’t carry a game on the soundtrack itself, so as you play Beatbuddy further, your only focus remains on the soundtrack which then ruins the mood itself. Even then, the soundtrack in Beatbuddy is excellent to say the least.
The Verdict
Beatbuddy is a wholly unremarkable game. Repetitive, Bland, Uninteresting are a  few words that can be used to describe it. I couldn’t bring myself to finish the game, as it felt so tedious to play through it. But if you want to give Beatbuddy; Tale of the guardians a try, wait for a sale as paying full price for this game will disappoint you to say the least.


This review is brought to you by Steamified. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit http://www.steamified.com/.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020031060', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1469628898}
review:
音と雰囲気を楽しめる人向けのアクションパズルゲーム

音楽を全体のデザインに取り込んでいて、
キャラクターの行動や仕掛けのオンオフとBGMとの連動だったり
リズムに合わせてアクションしないと動かない仕掛けがあったり
特定の拍でボタンを押すとテンポよく進める障害物があったりする

このゲームはリズム、パズル、アクションの属性を含んでいるが
リズムとアクションの融合が上手くいっておらず爽快感に欠け、
また、パズル、アクションを単体で見ても少々退屈だと感じた

音楽やリズムの爽快感に奉仕するようにステージが設計されておらず
せっかくノリの良いBGMでステップを踏むようなダッシュが出来るのに
マップは細い道が多く複雑で、すぐ壁のデコボコや敵キャラにぶつかって
止まってしまうのが、個人的にはストレスを感じた

「そういうゲームじゃないから」ってことなんだと思う
でもリズム要素を期待して始める人も少なくないんじゃないかな

・・・

ストーリーも一応あるんだけど、とくに深みとかはないし、
終わり方があっけないので過度な期待はしないように

ただキャラのセリフがボイパだったり、ナレーションの語りが、
英語なんだけどヒューマンサウンドボックス的な喋り方として成立してて
アートワークとともにそういう作りこみはしっかりしてるので、惜しいなぁ、と思う

ちなみに、スタッフロール中にも自キャラが操作可能である
画面端に行くと反対側から出てくる無限フィールドなので、
本編マップの狭苦しさの鬱憤を晴らすがごとく、のびのびと泳ぎまくってやったわ

author: {'steamid': '76561198025188158', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1469343222}
review:
Beatbuddy's strongest assest is easily its soundtrack. Beatbuddy's soundtrack has strong tunes of electroswing and funk and is overall pretty darn groovy. Though, Austin Wintory's track does suffer when it's stripped down to its bassline.
Overall the gameplay isn't bad. The gameplay you bounce to the beat and solve puzzles and traverse the levels. I think level design-wise it's constructed pretty well. If you're not a fan of it though, the game can be pretty repetative and uninteresting. I wouldn't go out of my way to buy it, but I got it in a bundle and I enjoyed what I got. I think it doesn't deserve most of the flak it gets, though the 2nd to last level was a little rough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041475734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1467065376}
review: Este juego no está mal. La idea me resultó original y la temática muy bien llevada. Es muy atrativo visualmente y la música lleva un ritmo muy bueno. El principal problema (y de ahí mi voto negativo) es que llega un punto en el cual el juego se hace pesado, repetitivo y un poco aburrido. A mi parecer, el juego sigue una única linea que lo único que hace es ir acelerándose cada vez más y exigir mayor destreza. Una lástima porque en un principio me parecio muy bueno y fue de más a menos según pasaban lso escenarios... y una lástima también porque considero que el juego podría tener muchas más posibilidades de las que muestra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159585437', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1576311944}
review:
I do recommend this game, but with a couple of warnings: 

I'm up to the last chapter of the 5th level, and I've had to go back to the menu and restart a chapter three times so far due to glitches preventing me from proceeding. I've spent absolutely ages swimming around trying to see if I've missed something, but checking out the discussion boards about the game, it seems like these are common bugs which have been occurring for a couple of years.

Also, while the music is good, it can get a *bit* repetitive; it might have been nice to have a little more variety.

HOWEVER, when the game is working fine, it's ridiculously good fun. A really unique play mechanism with some puzzles having a nice and challenging level of difficulty. They've nailed the difficulty curve.

Its standard price is £6.99 ($9.99 US I think?) which is *probably* worth it due to the amount of fun I've got out of it. But if you see it in a bundle or on, say, 50% off, it's an essential purchase for people who like 2D puzzle platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046417823', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1463930401}
review:
У разработчиков отлично получилось привнести музыку в геймплей. Первые уровни поразят вас атмосферой, графикой и тактом звука. Неплохая история, заставит вас пройтись по шести разичным локациям, услышать шесть разных (но чем то схожих) композиций, встретить забавных персонажей, пройти сквозь испытания и лёгкие и тяжёлые. Вы должны будете чувствовать ритм и решать головоломки. Благо разработчики не издеваются над игроком и не придумывают что-то невероятное как любят некоторые делать. Всё логично и просто, но в то же время интересно. Разве что в конце вам немного придётся попотеть, но и это не проблема. Повторюсь, история не плоха, но не тянет хоть на какую-то номинацию. Вся изюминка игры в атмофсфере и геймплее. Если вас интересуют подобные игры, то смело берите, не пожалеете. Я получил свою порцию удовольствия от процесса игры.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075927829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1462966660}
review:
無意義的節奏遊戲，不好玩的平台遊戲。
這個遊戲有著良好的精緻畫面，不過不失的美術，普普通通的音樂，怎樣都好的劇情，
還有不知道發生了什麼事的遊戲性
整個遊戲讓我玩到呵欠連連，遊戲性完全沒有出彩之處
不知道這個團隊裡有能力設計關卡的人才是跑光了還是放假了
可惜啊可惜，虧你畫面弄得美美的，也沒弄出什麼重大bug或反智機制
但趣味度依舊掉得滿地都是，麻煩找個有才能的關卡設計師吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047800149', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1460868633}
review:
Nothing particularly bad about this, just completely not notable in any way in my opinion. Felt very run of the mill. It's not awful or bad even, it's just a way to pass a few hours I guess. But there are more or less objectively better ways to do that (like I'm sorry, I understand that it's opinion but I really think that if you're a person that's been playing video games for any semi-significant length of time at all, you will think this is very generic--I think that's a fairly reasonable assumption to make). The game just doesn't feel like it has any identity or reason for existence beyond "another indie 2D platformer/puzzle game in a sea of indie 2D platformer/puzzle games".

Its underwater so you're not tethered to the ground in the 2D space. Has some strong music (I mean it's called Beatbuddy and it's sorta music-themed in concept so the music is fairly varied and not bad). 6 Levels, about 40-60m each. Really not challenging at all, even near the end as the difficulty ramped up, everything was fairly easy. Honestly, any difficulty or annoyance came almost entirely from the annoyingly floaty controls (I used mouse option, there are "Keyboard" and "Gamepad"  options as well. It's never bad enough to hinder progress though, as the difficulty isn't high at all as mentioned for it to become a massive headache. The "puzzles" are all very on-rails, you don't have to think, it's just sorta "pull lever, push crate" (figuratively). A lot of repeating puzzle pieces just thrown together in different ways throughout the game, more pieces as you go further.

The game seems to be into this idea that the beat of the music tracks in each of its level is synchronized to various environmental elements and mechanics of its puzzles, and while this might be technically true (i.e., an object you can interact with that serves as like a bounce-pad is pulsating to the beat), in practice I never found myself actually concerned with using that to help me *play the game*, which it sort of advertises as a selling point, but also via it's early tutorial. This might be somewhat subjective, as maybe other people would use that more as a play tool, but I found it far easier to just ignore all that and use visual cues as in any other game (i.e. if there are like spikes that drop and raise, even if they "cycle" with the song, it's easier to just watch the spikes and then time your passage...).

Graphics are uh, fine. Somewhat pretty , levels look repetitive (similar art assets I mean) but they all sort of have a cartoony stylization. Really nothing eye-popping, definitely far from the most beautiful 2D game I've seen, recently or otherwise. Look at some screenshots to judge of course.

I encountered a bug in Level 5 , where upon going through a door and the camera starting to zoom out on the environment after a certain puzzle, the client crashed literally every time (Unity engine error). Was not a 1-time thing, always hapspened as I moved the character through this point. After looking around and finding no solution, I verified game cache and that seemed to work. Notably, the game hitched and stuttered , but didn't crash at that point still. 

Also , the game has no v-sync option, v-sync force doesn't work via Nvidia control panel. I'm running a GTX 770, and it was basically just eating the card to run at like 1000+ frames per second (no, that's not a zero too many. Over 1 thousand frames. Basically if you have a dedicated gpu of any description, beware). Was incredibly annoying, and I ended up artificially capping the frame rate with RivaTuner. Which caused the game to occassionally experience some weird stuttering. Sort of amateurish that there's no Vysync option tbh, or anything else that'd solve that issue.

________________________________________

Pros: 

- Strong, varied music, all catchy and pretty unique in the video game landscape.
- Visually decent.

Cons: 

- Boring puzzles, not challenging or thought-provoking
- Poor control of character (floaty)
- Repetitive level design
- Generic
- Somewhat buggy
- Doesn't support vsync

author: {'steamid': '76561198031617164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1463218672}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999920602', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 622, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1504549181}
review: The first level of this game is a great experience - discovering creatures the build up the background loop. The music in the game is awesome, and it's relaxing to play. In the later stages, the gameplay can get a bit frustrating, and the dialogue and story aren't great, but it's worth playing just for the music. author: {'steamid': '76561198116384968', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1459191223}
review:
(Più una prima impressione che una recensione)

Questo gioco non fa nulla in modo tremendo, ma allo stesso tempo risulta piuttosto blando, generico e non terribilmente intereressante.

Il gameplay e le meccaniche sono fin troppo semplici, mentre stile di disegno e colonna sonora sono entrambi competenti e gradevoli, ma risultano piuttosto triti.
Storia, atmosfera, dialoghi e personaggi potevano anche non essere inclusi per quanto sono irrilevanti.

A primo acchito, il gioco viaggia tra "accettabile" e "mediocre".

review:
[h1]ENTRETENIDO[/h1]

La verdad que no esperaba mucho de este juego, pero resulta que es muy entretenido y nos va a engancar. En todos los niveles tendremos una serie de rompecabezas, bastante fáciles de resolver, al resolverlos podremos continuar en nuestra misión. Lo que da vida a este juego es la música y el ritmo, muy metidos en el juego. 

Lo recomiendo para entretenerse de forma esporádica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028429100', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1455144197}
review:
TL;DR: It's not bad. It's well made, but it's too bland for a definite reccommendation.

This game, uh... I don't know how to put this. I mean, I just completed it one minute ago but I think I can sum things up.
If you skip this title, you're not missing much. I don't feel like my time was wasted, but there are more interesting games out there that I can't say pick this one up. I got it as a Humble Bundle order, and honestly wouldn't have played it if it weren't for that fact. Don't get me wrong, what it does is alright. For the most part the obstacles move to the beat rather than you, which is unique along with its art and setting.
I'm only giving it a thumbs-down because I don't ESPECIALLY recommend it. If there were a more neutral option I'd give it. It's not an involving game, so if you need that then it might suit you. I'm pretty sure this was a college project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1454246611}
review:
The soundtrack is amazing. Its one of the better ones Ive found in a rhythm game, and I like how they incorporated it into the actual gameplay and environment. I liked having to time my hits to break through bubbles or to break those flower things in the later levels. I can see how some people might get irritated with it though because the game is set underwater, and you have a bit of lag/delay. It isnt too bad to get used to though.

Graphics were pretty nice too. I loved the animations, especially the idle ones. The environment was a little same-y after awhile (lot of recoloring it seemed like), but still gorgeous. 

Controls (especially vehicle ones) werent my favorite, but luckily they dont stick you in the bubble car very often. Trying to actually time the speed boost in the vehicle was a bit irritating, but holding the right click seemed to do it automatically, so I cant complain too much. 

The puzzles themselves werent too bad. None of them were overly complicated or frustrating, but some did get a little repetitive in the earlier levels. Still pretty enjoyable though.

The story is one of the weaker parts of the game. It isnt the strongest story out there, and the characters arent very memorable. Personally, I think the gameplay more than makes up for the weak story though.

Its different, which is nice to see with so many puzzle platformers out there. The controls take getting used to, but once you do it plays very well. The audio is beyond relaxing and the environments are gorgeous. Id highly recommend it, especially if you catch it on sale or in a bundle somewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976045691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1666578603}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978025240', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1453165269}
review:
People call this a platformer game.

I disagree.  This is more of a bullet hell rhythm hybrid.

Fist thing to note, is that the sound track is probably one of the best things about this game.  As it should, too, as the majority of gameplay mechanics are built around the beat of that soundtrack.

There isn't much in form of a story, sadly, but what's there is enough to at least give a sense of purpose and the characters created are rather colorful and entertaining to view/interact with.

This is more of a relaxing/casual game than anything, so keep that in mind.

~STL

author: {'steamid': '76561198032311213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1455467588}
review:
I didn't expect much from this game but I have to tell you what a surprise hit it turned out to be.


When the music beat start you can't help but tap your foot in time to it. something that turns out to come in handy through out the game, as everything is timed to the music.  The story is fairly simple but it had me smiling the whole time I played the game.

For a light game, good music, and overall enjoyable experience how can you go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151392680', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1442956646}
review: Trilha sonora e jogabilidade muito boas. Vale muito a pena viver a experiencia de joga-lo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1435551608}
review:
Peculiar jogo de aventura com grande influência musical, Beatbuddy diz respeito a um desiquilíbrio em Symphonia, o mundo da música, causado por um imperador cruel que pretendia calar todas as notas e toma-las para si.

O avanço nas fases se dá conforme os sons propostos que deverão ser acompanhados pelo jogador para resolver os desafios que vão surgindo pelo caminho, acrescentando-se novos sons e novas formas de combina-lós à medida em que se avança na campanha.

Há um toque de humor nos diálogos, que aliados a uma bela produção de arte feitas durante os 6 capitulos do jogo, tornam tudo bem interessante. A maioria dos desafios propostos não são tão desafiadores assim, alguns até muito obvios, mas nada que não possa ser relevado.

No geral, Beatbuddy é um jogo bacana, que eu joguei sem esperar muita coisa, mas acabei achando divertido. Pode-se dizer que é pelo menos diferente da maioria das coisa que se vê por ai. BOM (7/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085050894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1451423154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023133511', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1450029121}
review:
Petit jeu sympathique. 
La musique est très entraînante (même si je trouve celle du niveau 1 plus prenante ce qui rend celles des niveaux suivants un tantinet décevantes) et les puzzle amusants au-début. Ceux-ci sont malheureusement un peu répétitifs par la suite. Le visuel, sans être incroyable, rend bien et accompagne bien le ton comique des dialogues. Les dialogues, justement, sont peu nombreux mais "doublés" par des beatbox donnant corps aux personnages interprétés ; c'est un détail, mais c'est sympa !

Vous occupera quelques heures et vaut le coup d'être chopé à l'occasion de soldes. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016403351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1449311717}
review:
Apaisant, dynamique, rythmique ...
L'univers possède un level design digne de certains contes.
La musique est en phase avec le jeu, savoir jouer en rythme aide beaucoup, mais n'est pas indispensable non plus.
Jamais très dur au point de recommencer certains passages plus de 5 ou 6 fois, le jeu alterne puzzle et recherche d'élément, affrontement contre quelques créatures, parcours du combattant semés d'embuches.
Les levels sont plutôt variés, et pour la durée assez courte du jeu, c'est suffisant.
L'histoire derrière le jeu est un pretexte intéressant, mais pas forcément la plus captivante qui soit, ceci dit, les répliques sont parfois assez caustiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994799155', 'num_games_owned': 1524, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1468307984}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043031097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1541864771}
review:
Yes I recommend this game BUT not to everypony.

Beatbuddy is, mostly, a rhythm game before everything else. Of course you have some puzzles, you have some exploration, action, even some auto-scrolling... plus, regarding how you're playing, it can be a point'n click, and that is quite funny, I love it that way. You can choose between gamepad / keyboard or mouse. Not keyboard AND mouse, but keyboard OR mouse.

So yes, it's a rhythm game. You're free to go where you want, but the enemies and various obstacles are all based on the rhythm of the soundtrack (which is great, try to listen to it in iTunes). So if you're not fond of this kind of gameplay, maybe you'll not like this game. Plus, the puzzles are not really that hard. It's not an easy game, but it's not really hard either.

Because what I like is this kind of "flow" you feel when you're playing, your actions matching with the tempo, that feeling that everything is going well, you're "in". I don't really know how to explain it, because I feel it, but you got the idea I hope.

Pros:
- amazing OST if you like electronic music (electro swing and stuff)
- easy controlling
- the graphics, not really the quality (it's good though) but the atmosphere you know?

Cons:
- not really hard
- low replay value

Those are not really cons if you can enjoy the game enough the first time you play. I think it's worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096030981', 'num_games_owned': 5222, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1446341081}
review:
这游戏我很久以前就开坑了，然后弃了好久，前几天才接着玩，然后直接用了一个下午把剩下的打通了。。。
怎么说呢，最开始吸引我的是这个游戏的节奏感很强，但是刚开始玩的时候由于智商捉急，经常卡在路上，卡着卡着就弃坑了，然后接着玩的时候大概是因为这段时间智力点加的有点多LEVEL UP了，所以很顺畅的就通关了。
总的来说，这是个轻度烧脑不伤手的休闲游戏，地图设计挺合理，不是很复杂，虽然有时候一眼看过去不知道走哪里好，但是闭着眼乱冲稀里糊涂就这么过去了，当然，对路痴来说可能会有点麻烦，毕竟没有小地图嘛。
剧情方面，其实我根本没看懂，或者说根本就不想看。。。本来我英语就不好，你还非要把所有字母都大写，这。。。
音乐方面，其实很一般，大多数时候BGM都被各种动次打次的节奏给掩盖了，而且自带曲目并不多，唯一值得一提的是第四章有段BGM好像和无主2开场动画里面那个是同一首，当时听着觉得好熟悉还想了半天来着。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040494704', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1445507834}
review:
A very charming beat-keeping puzzle game. Gorgeous art, fluid animation and a killer soundtrack that changes depending on what's on screen. Everything keeps to the beat, from the pulsating plants to the animations of the main character.

The puzzles within are simple, yet challenging enough to keep you playing, and often rely on matching the beat to succeed. The game is controlled entirely with the mouse, so laptop gamers and people with no sense of rhythm need not apply. Other than that, I can highly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1445282948}
review:
Wieder so ein Spiel für das man einen dritten Daumen bräuchte. Das Spiel ist zwar in Ordnung, aber krankt für mich am zu langsamen Pacing. Die Rätsel sind sich alle sehr ähnlich und lassen sich eher durch mehr Aufwand als durch Grips lösen. Soundtrack ist natürlich Geschmackssache, aber es variiert zu wenig. Hab das Gefühl stundenlang die selbe Musik zu hören, bevor es mal nen neuen Sound gibt. So hat mich die Musik eher genervt als bei der Stange gehalten. 

Wer seichte Puzzleplattformer ohne viel Anspruch mag, der kann es sich ruhig mal anschauen. Der Rhythmus spielt gar keine allzugroße Rolle. Der Beat beeinflusst zwar die Umgebung, aber man kommt auch zurecht ohne auf ihn achten zu müssen Das raubt einem leider viel Motivation, da so der Anspruch verloren geht. Hört bei Youtube mal in den Soundtrack rein. Wenn er euch zusagt, dann holt es euch ruhig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027882402', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1441918766}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119808516', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1444784647}
review:
2Dアクションアドベンチャー

難易度は低いほうです．
リズムに合わせて移動すると速く移動できたり，障害物がリズムに合わせて切り替わったりするなど，BGMとゲームプレイがリンクしているのが特徴．
かなり鮮やかなグラフィックは人を選ぶかもしれません．
パズル要素はほぼなく道なりに進んでいけばサクサククリアできるでしょう．死んでもオートセーブですぐ復活．
日本語対応しているのでストーリーもわかりやすい．ただストーリー自体は特に新鮮なものではないです．
音楽が特徴なだけあってBGMの出来はいいです．
全体的にまあまあおすすめできるゲーム．
