author: {'steamid': '76561197995766772', 'num_games_owned': 6818, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1442959060}
review:
Povedená hudební hra, která připomínala Capsized bez zbraní. Vše v daném levelu se pohybuje v rytmu hudby, což přidává na unikátnosti této hry, která se však bohužel postupně vytrácí a ke konci jsem to už dohrál ze setrvačnosti. Škoda technických problémů, kdy se mě hra zasekla a musel jsem část hry hrát odznova. Jinak však doporučuji všem milovníkům hudby a trochy přemýšlení.

+steam kartičky
+steam achievementy
+hudební doprovod

-možné záseky a nutnost restartu hry
-hra si nedokázala udržet zábavnost až do konce
-občas zlobilo ovládání (hrál jsem pomocí myši)

Hru jsem získal za 0,29€.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043216138', 'num_games_owned': 1653, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1442689933}
review:
Al ver por primera vez BeatBuddy nos preguntamos si no estuviésemos frente al típico indie que tiene una idea original detrás, pero que nos hace dudar si los desarrolladores la han conseguido ejecutar correctamente. 
Desde luego no podemos negar que este juego destaca principalmente por su estética y su apartado musical, los cuales, para mi gusto están sorprendentemente bien cuidados.
En cuanto a jugabilidad, BeatBuddy cuenta con unos controles muy simples y cómodos para jugar con mando, y responde perfectamete en todo momento. Esto, unido a unas mecánicas simples y a una dificultad bastante baja, hacen de BeatBuddy un juego sencillo y fácil de jugar.
Tanta sencillez, tanto en mecánicas como en dificultad podría convertirlo en un juego repetitivo y tedioso, de no ser por su corta duración y su variedad de escenarios. 
BeatBuddy consta de 6 niveles temáticos de 1h aproximada de duración cada uno, en los que alternaremos entre el control de Beat y su nave, lo que aporta un poco de variedad en la forma de juego. Durante estos 6 niveles, dará tiempo de sobra a que se desarrolle la historia, el punto más flojo de este juego para mi gusto: Eres uno de los 3 guardianes de la música, que despiertan cuando el príncipe intenta controlar todo su poder, y debes frustrar sus planes. 

En definitiva, estamos frente a un juego con un gameplay sencillo, de corta duración e historia simple, aunque fresco y novedoso a la vez, con una estética y música que conjuntan a la perfección, consiguiendo una inmersión total en el mismo que te dejará con muy buen sabor de boca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003284649', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1438413847}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025820005', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1442173951}
review:
Music in this game is astoundingly good. Sadly, the level design is uninspired and the puzzles are repetitive. The checkpoint system doesn't work super well, leading to many broken event triggers.

Made it to chapter 4 before encountering a checkpoint bug that stuck me in one area of a level, and no further progress was possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053169595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1442166744}
review:
Was very disappointed in the controls and the gameplay. The only real pro was the music, but it never reached its full potential. The reason why I bought this game was to hear the music, yet many of the games mechanics like hitting objects to remove spikes and finding secret buttons muted the music. The puzzles did not feel satisfying because generally you have to just memorize paths and could be done in one go. Controls feel delayed especially when in vehicles as it forces you to move to the beat. Dashing around also feels really weird as when you press and hold you move faster at the expense of control.

Overall this is a bellow average game where its strengths are hurt by its gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023903090', 'num_games_owned': 1531, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1441406069}
review:
Tale of the Guardians es un juego de aventuras y puzzle ambientado en el fondo marino. Los habitantes de este mundo, conocidos como Symphonian, se mueven al ritmo de la música la cual va a estar muy presente durante todo el juego.

Muchos enemigos o zonas se comportan de una forma u otra según la música o los sonidos procedentes de otros elementos del mapa, por lo que en algunas situaciones solo hay que seguir el ritmo para superar estos obstáculos.

Gráficamente el juego sorprende bastante, los detalles están bien cuidados y transportan al jugador a este pequeño gran mundo musical subacuático.

El juego tiene una demo, así que podéis probarlo antes de decidir si comprarlo o no.

Aprovechad si lo encontrais de oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001788291', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1419702383}
review: I bought the game for music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020748121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1522424956}
review: El juego básicamente consiste en avanzar resolviendo puzzles y ir derrotando o esquivando a los enemigos y obstáculos que nos encontramos por el camino. El protagonismo por encima de todo está en la música, cada enemigo emite su propio sonido, los personajes hacen beatbox a la hora de hablarnos y incluso es necesario seguir el ritmo de la musica de fondo  para manejar con rapidez un vehículo o acabar con cierto enemigo golpeandolo con ritmo. Afortunadamente la música es de calidad, variada y se disfruta mucho, el control es bueno y reacciona al instante. Los gráficos en 2d como se puede ver en cualquier vídeo sobre el juego sin ser lo más son muy agradables a la vista, destacando sobre todo el buen diseño y animación de personajes y enemigos .  Por ponerle un punto negativo o no tan bueno, tal vez los escenarios podrían estar todavia más trabajados, los elementos que los componen resultan bastante simples en comparación al resto. Mejorando eso y añadiendo físicas para las algas, cajas, etc., daría para un remaster de estos que están tan de moda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086917932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1441170693}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians; an indie platformer from Threaks. Let’s get rocking (and rightly so with this one).

The Good

To be honest, I hadn’t even heard of this game until it came with last week’s Humble Bundle, but am I glad that it came in that glorious bundle of games. Beatbuddy is easily one of the most satisfying games I have ever played and an multiple levels at that. The whole game is, quite literally, moving to the beat. Do you have any idea how good that feels?

Not only was the whole game keeping rhythm, the music was excellent. I’m personally a big fan of Parov Stellar, so, when I found out about that contribution to the soundtrack, I was pretty stoked. Every level features a different song from a different artist, but manages to keep the same flow.

The design in Beatbuddy is simply marvelous (for the most part). It’s rare to see such a creative game in terms of world building and (especially) naming things cleverly.

The Bad

I’ve got nothing bad to say about this one, sorry.

The Meh

There are some parts of the game where it becomes overly difficult to maneuver with your character. It’s not a huge problem or anything (and maybe I just suck), but it can be quite frustrating.

Verdict: Yea

You have absolutely zero reasons not be playing this game within the next week or so. If you’ve been looking for something new and something far different than most platformers, Beatbuddy is the game for you. You can find it here on Steam if you’re interested (and you should be). It may end up on Humble Bundle’s End of Summer Sale too so keep an eye on that. As always, thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069979998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1440464798}
review: I HATE having to give this game such a bad review, cause i loved playing it up to a certain point. I got to the Organ Level and everything was great, suddenly the game started glitching. It's a music/beat based game and yet some of the wildlife that are supposed to move in time with the music, weren't moving, which means i couldn't use them. I have restarted and reloaded the game over and over and yet this keeps happening. I believe that i have played it to a point where it is unbeatable. If anyone knows any way around these glitches, please let me know as i would LOVE to finish this game, but as it stands now...i must advise against purchasing this product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044096999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1440176430}
review:
Clearly a labor of love, Beatbuddy shines in its aesthetic, world, and gameplay "feel." Everything around you moves to the beat of the music. Even your own vehicle gets a speed boost every other beat. 

This all comes together to make a game that *usually* feels great to play. While the developers have obviously put a lot of thought into designing each level, there are still segments that are simply not fun to play. In many situations, you will find yourself punished and killed for making a wrong decision in a fast-paced segment. This happens often enough and comes with a large enough punishment that it really does detract from the gameplay.

It feels like this problem comes from over-attachment to problematic gameplay elements. For example, throughout the game, there are these "music sources" which are unstable and explode after you've held them long enough. You have to deliver these sources to an appropriate receptacle or risk restarting the segment. While having segments like this helps the game from feeling too same-y, it's a bad choice and should have been scrapped or re-imagined.

To be honest, though, these flaws are the kind of thing that most games have. It might have a few more of them than average, but they only stand out because they occasionally disrupt the magical experience that this game has to offer. Despite my occasional frustration, I finished this game in a single sitting and came away delighted that I'd put in the time. I would recommend this game to anyone who's at all interested by the trailer. Just don't expect it to be perfectly polished.

(For those who care, playtime isn't tremendously long for a $10 game. But I don't really think it's fair to judge games by playtime; you're paying for the art, music, and creativity. If you're hesitant, get it on sale.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987406958', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1411162478}
review:
Музыкальные игры у меня раньше не вызывали особой радости, ибо в них не доставало глубины и сюжета. Вот тут и появляется Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians. Игра с сюжетом, ритмичной музыкой, головоломками и бесконечными заплывами синего человечка через подводные пещеры.

Плюсы:
- Танцующие раки
- Управляемая техника
- Даже сложные враги дают тебе люлей под музыку
- Еще одна добрая сказка на ночь
- Игра для релакса с геймпадом

Минусы:
- С клавиатурки играть не удобно

author: {'steamid': '76561198077538197', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1498841850}
review:
Even if I feel mixed, I'll recomend this game.

The graphics are beautiful.
The gameplay is really cool but tend to be the same all the way to the end. (I wanted to see more "music tricks")
The musics are awesome but tend to be long after a long play... Mainly because of the tempo : and this is why I feel mixed about this game.

Basically you'll need 30min for each chunk of the game. It is good enough to apreciate the music without hating it. this part is well done.
But what I did not like is that there is no variation of the tempo : every songs have the same tempo ! 
So even if the music change every 30min, it's getting anoying after a while...

Still, I recommend this game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198076039301', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1433430120}
review:
Es ist jedes Mal wieder traurig es zu schreiben, aber: Eines der sehr wenigen Spiele in meiner Bibliothek, an welchem deutsche Entwickler beteiligt waren! ;)

BEATBUDDY: TotG ist ein sehr musikalisches Indiegame, das in etwa 4 Stunden Spielzeit bis zum Ende bietet und diese Zeit füllt das Spiel mit tollen Rhythmen, einer netten kleinen Story und einem konkurrenzfähigem Grafikstil! Bugs suchte ich vergeblich, die Steuerung per X360-Controller ist weitaus besser als mit Tastatur/Maus.

Gesamtbewertung: 80/100

GAMEPLAY: Sehr flüssige, eingehende Steuerung, die bei dieser Spiellänge aber nicht zu simpel und einschränkend wirkt. [90/100]

STORY: Süße, kurze Story, welche perfekt in den Spielfluß eingebaut ist. Einen Blockbusters darf man natürlich nicht erwarten, doch auf Indie-Niveau absolut in Ordnung. [80/100]

GRAFIK: Sehr netter Grafikstil, keine Unschönheiten, die Produktbeschreibung verspricht nicht zu viel! Auch die Animationen des Beatbuddy sehen cool aus. Allerdings finde ich den Look der Menüs abstoßend [90/100]

SOUND: Die rhythmische Musik ist definitiv das Kernelement dieses Titels. Die Musik ist immer auf die derzeitige Spielgeschwindigkeit abgestimmt (oder anders herum :D ) und ist eingängig. Allerdings findet sich hier keine neue 'Star-Wars-Musik', die sich jedermann nach dem ersten Hören merken kann; auch nicht im Soundtrack. Somit: [85/100]

=> Alles in allem ein nettes Indie-Game mit einer für dieses Spielprinzip genau rcihtigen Länge und netten Ideen. Sehr guter Zeitvertreib -> [80/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561198085439995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1411234942}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120732191', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1402374461}
review:
Включает в себя взаимодействие с игроками и влияние на музыкальное сопровождение, когда они проходят через различные уровни среди шести миров. Игра сосредоточена на существе по имени Бадди, пытающимся спасти свою родину Symphonia от армии Принца Маэстро.

Каждый уровень в BeatBuddy синхронизирован с фоновой музыкальной композицией, которая меняется, в зависимости от ваших действий.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025926879', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1443469383}
review:
I can absolutely recommend this game. I agree in a way with the sluggish controls many reviewers describe but they rarely keep me from really enjoying this game. They just become part of the challenge and I feel you can master them without being too irritated about it. The pure fun and enjoyment of simple but groovy gameplay is all worth it though and the puzzles do progress the further you go. I've been playing this game with my projector on a 100 inch scale and the visuals and detail in the art are mind-blowing. At times it's like an lsd-trip.

This game was completely worth it for me.
 If you're not sure, just get it in a sale, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128622576', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1437373160}
review:
This game was not as fun as I thought it would be, but it was okay. Not the kind of game I'd get immersed into and play for hours straight... rather 10 minutes at a time, because the game tends to get annoying if you play it for longer periods. The graphics are colorful and nice, the animations smooth, the gameplay a bit dull, the controls somewhat tedious but not catastrophic either. I'd still recommend it because the way the music is integrated into the game is original and pretty well done, and the tracks themselves are good (except for level 5 which was quite a bit grating...). I also appreciated the nice little details, such as skippable intro logos (a rare and precious attention) and the fact that you can still control the character during the ending credits.

I give this game 6/10, and if there was to be a Beatbuddy 2 with solid improvements, I think I'd consider buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049130822', 'num_games_owned': 1421, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1705297736}
review:
This is a very simple game that requires some problem solving to get through the levels. The game mechanics are simple and I've seen it done in many others. That said, what sets this game apart is the incorporation of the music into the gameplay. You have to match the beat to get through certain areas. The music is great, and I love that the character voices are different beatboxing beats for each character. The artwork in the game is very pleasing with the bright colors and the animation in the environment adds visual cues to help you match the beat.

While playing this game I found myself tapping my foot and nodding my head to the beat. Great way to spend a relaxing afternoon, and the little blobby characters brought a smile to my face.

I'd definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023559435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1436753958}
review: The game is sort of a puzzle platformer type thing, but is not really a platformer. Rather, you click places and move there. The music theme is nice, but I found the controls awkward and the puzzles were more time-consuming than engaging. The reason I don't recommend the game is because I think it glitched into a unbeatable state in the second half of the organ level then saved a checkpoint, and I cannot continue the game.

What's up with the ticks (parasites), I don't know. They look ugly and don't fit in the environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086480169', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1435327582}
review: Beautiful graphics, great music and some really creative ideas but I can't recommend it due to quite a few bugs/glitches and the fact that the controls/mechanics of this game make me really angry whenever I try to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996760968', 'num_games_owned': 1341, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1393951353}
review:
I love rhythm and heavily music influenced games.  I've a downright sensational rhythm if I do say so myself.  I played the demo for this nearly a year before it was released and was absolutely hyped... then the full game came out.

With such an ominous intro like that, how could this be a thumbs up?  Well, it's still a nice and casual adventure game with a silly story and characters that functions correctly most of the time.  It has a lot of heart put into it with the fine details like the "voice overs" and the graphics and rhythm syncing, but it feels... lacking.

The demo had this insanely upbeat and cool song that's difficult to find today, and being a beta demo I figured some things would change from there to the final product.  I was wrong.  The songs now are more like background beats that the game just sort of arbitrarily bounces to.  You could take the rhythmic pulses out of the game and have almost the same game with less "stuttering".

I can still recommend this, though.  The characters are cute, the mood is lighthearted, the songs are still fun, and it still pulls off the adventure bit with light puzzle elements, but oh what this game could have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119046494', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 66, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1710117489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094039068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1701976754}
review: I've been really enjoying this game. The plot is a bit cliche, but the beats and puzzles are pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088831334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1435225464}
review:
I am surprised by how good this game is.  It is a rhythm puzzle platforming game.  It is really fun moving around with the great beat, and the puzzles are really good.  I love how the game looks: colorful and smooth.  The animations and controls are awesome.  The story is very simple, but for this type of game, it is alright.

It is good for 5-6 hours of fun with possible replay value.  Pick it up when it is on sale if you like rhythm, puzzle, or platforming games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021192043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1434595955}

review: Beatbuddy ist ein wirklich kurzes Spiel. Ich brauchte 4h um es durchzuspielen und die Extras sind nicht wirklich sinnvoll. Dennoch die Musik und die Gestaltung der Level ist wirklich einzigartig. Die Idee das die Spielwelt die Musik erzeugt und ihr im Beat folgt ist wirklich interresant. Es hätte aber noch viel mehr drin sein können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025537397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1432133093}
review:
リズムに合わせて操作するACTゲーム。１時間ほどプレイしてみましたが、
自分は音感・リズム感がないので、愉しいポイントが分からなかった。
ビートに合わせて移動や攻撃をすれば爽快なのかもしれません。(-_-;)

ローカライズ丁寧、ビジュアルも美麗、BGMも良いので、リズムに載って
ゲーム出来る人にはお勧め出来そうです。

個人的には非常に惜しいタイトル、自分にあわなかったので評価は↓です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198077869887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1416457594}
review: This game has lots of pretty colors, and the musical rhythm worked into the gameplay is unique. Unfortunately, those two aspects do not change the fact that the gameplay is pretty identical to a myriad of other games out there. Now I love shooters. I have played tons of shooters and there isn't really one I regret playing because each is unique and different in it's own way. If you feel the same way about this genre, then maybe this game is for you.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197981891635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1430326695}
review:
Fun little game. Good few hours worth of content. Nice story, and the music is awesome! Big fan of game and music intergration, and it works really well. Good sense of humour and doesn't take it self very seriously, which I like. 
Only down side for me to this game, is the controls. I found them very clunky and never fully got used to using either the keyboard or the mouse. Seems to be optimised for a controller. 

Decent game though, worth a grab if cheap and on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995211255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1653960972}
review: This game is a must have. The music is amazing and highly addictive. I found myself humming along to the music as I played. The levels can be challenging but not so difficult as to be impassable. It did glitch out on me a couple of times and I had to save and exit and then re-launch and it worked fine. I generally get bored with games and leave them in favor of a new game. I played this all the way through to the end. I highly recommend this game to everyone. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028635556', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1430204479}
review:
I really don't know how to feel about Beatbuddy. The game isn't really fun but it isn't really boring either. It's just a simple game where you flip switches and flow down corridors whilst the music changes based upon environmental hazards. The music is enjoyable but the game doesn't really compliment it a lot of the time. If you want a Music game this one has music and it's a game but that doesn't make it a music game. 

The story isn't something to write about as I felt there really wasn't a story. The Deus Ex Machina at the end really ruined anything that was going on in the game and then it just suddenly ends. The story feels tacked on and hardly there. 

The Soundtrack is nice but doesn't really compliment the game in any way. It's a very Electro Swing heavy OST by some big names but overall I felt that it's more of an advertisement for the artists than anything. 

Overall this game is very mediocre. It isn't really fun and only held my attention for the first couple levels. The last levels just left me dissatisfied and overall perturbed when I completed the game. This game is okay, but there are pleanty of better games available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996113496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3324, 'last_played': 1429385396}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians entführt den Spieler in eine Welt, die von [b]Rhythmus und Musik[/b] bestimmt wird. In der comichaften zweidimensionalen Unterwasserwelt bewegt sich alles zum Bass der Musik. Die Hindernisse, die Gegner und bald schon man selbst.

Die Entwickler legen offensichtlich großen Wert auf [b]Innovationen im Gameplay[/b]. Entsprechend knapp haben Sie die Geschichte und die Spielwelt gehalten. Böser Prinz entführt Schwester um alle Musik zu kontrollieren. Der Spielheld muss das verhindern. Mit Blick auf das Gameplay ist die durch Einblendung von Sprechblasen erzählte Geschichte mehr als ausreichend. Der Fokus liegt auf dem Spielgefühl.

Und das begeistert, jedenfalls zu Anfang. Was in anderen Spielen die Hand-Auge-Koordination ist, ist bei Beatbuddy die [b]Hand-Gehör-Koordination[/b]. Schnell lernt man, die Entwicklung der Spielwelt mit Hilfe des eigenen Gehörs vorauszuahnen und das eigene Spiel daran anzupassen. Durchschwimmt die Spielfigur etwa eine knifflige Passage, welche sich nur zu bestimmten Rhythmen öffnet, so muss sie den richtigen Zeitpunkt erahnen. Das ist [b]ausgesprochen innovativ[/b] und macht gerade zu Anfang sehr viel Spaß.

Umso bedauerlicher ist, dass die Entwickler weder das Innovationstempo, noch das Musikkonzept konsequent durchhalten. Zum einen beschränkt sich die Auswirkung der Musik auf die Spielwelt im Grunde auf den Bass. Und der ist binär. An. Und dann Aus. An. Aus. Da wäre so viel mehr möglich gewesen, selbst wenn man nur Takt und Bass genommen hätte. Zum anderen driftet das Spiel [b]mit fortschreitender Entwicklung wieder ins Koventionelle[/b] ab. Irgendwann muss sich der Spieler mit Parasiten rumschlagen, denen die sonst so harmonische Welt egal ist. Sie greifen einfach immer an, ohne Rücksicht auf den Beat. An vielen anderen Stellen gerät das Spiel einfach zur Geschicklichkeitsübung, ohne dass die Musik eine Rolle spielt. 

Weniger begeisternd ist auch das Leveldesign. Obwohl die Welt des Beatbuddys [b]optisch durchaus schön anzusehen[/b] ist, ist die zunehmende Labyrinthartigkeit der Level doch nur vorgetäuscht. Tatsächlich bleiben sie linear, die Wegfindung minimal und ein ganz erheblicher Teil besteht nur im Durchschwimmen kniffliger Passagen. Ganz besonders markant ist aber, dass die immer [b]gleichen Konzepte permament wiederholt[/b] werden. Sei es nun eine Art Wagen, der in Parasitenpassagen durch die Reihen des Gegners schlüpft. Die Spielfigur, die sich über Spiegel gegen Korallen schießen lässt, damit diese zerplatzen und den weg frei geben. Oder die schießenden Schnecken, die sich in puncto Nervigkeit mit schwimmenden stachlichen Amöben abwechseln. In den ersten zwei Leveln ist alles neu und innovativ. Aber dann kommt leider nur noch wenig. 

Immerhin, und wie sollte es anders sein, gelingt den Entwicklern eine [b]tolle musikalische Unterstützung[/b]. Die elektronischen Klänge mit zum Teil ambitioniertem wortlosen Gesang sind jedoch absolut gelungen. Was die Spielmusik angeht läuft dieses Indiegame einfach mal AAA-Titeln den Rang ab. Allein dafür lohnt Beatbuddy. 

Da verzeiht man auch den [b]recht einfachen Schwierigkeitsgrad.[/b] Von Beginn an ist das Spiel keine Herausforderung, nicht einmal für Casualgamer. Wenige Passagen fordern ab und an ein ausgesprochen schnelles Handeln, aber abseits dessen ist das Spiel kaum Herausforderung.

Im Ergebnis bietet Beatbuddy vor allem eins: [b]Innovation[/b], was das Spielgefühl angeht. Das das nicht durchgehalten wird, bleibt verziehen. Gerade die Spielmusik gibt des Spiel einen [b]Indiecharme[/b], der einem einfach ein gutes Gefühl gibt. Ich empfehle es daher gerne weiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985262092', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1414994918}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 466, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1428460190}
review:
[code]Puedes ver más reseñas como esta en la mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta reseña no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians ha sido una sorpresa absoluta. Obtenido de "rebote" a partir de un blundle hace un par de años parecía que este juego iba a ser uno de esos que se tienen y nunca se juegan. Sin embargo, también sucede que a veces jugamos a algo "por probar" y nos quedamos maravillados. Este es el caso de este juego.

Beatbuddy es un juego que se desarrolla en un fondo marino donde tendremos que salvarlo de un malvado principe que quiere hacerse con la música. El argumento es realmente trivial y queda en un segundo plano cuando comenzamos a jugar, ya que sin lugar a dudas lo más destacable de este juego es su impresionante música. 

Tal es así que mientras jugamos vamos acompañando nuestros movimientos con la múscia que suena, no porque nos obliguen, sino porque el ritmo es realmente excelente. Música funky, electrónica y varias notas de jazz y blues hacen que desplazarnos por el fondo del mar sea realmente espectacular.

Su aspecto gráfico, por otro lado, es fabuloso. Es una auténtica maravilla ver los paisajes, enemigos, y elementos que configuran los puzles para darse cuenta del gran trabajo que han realizado los desarrolladores. Colores vivos, dinámicos y con una gran personalidad.

En su aspecto puramente jugable, el juego es una mezcla de puzles, arcade y shoot 'em up, dependiendo del nivel, y todo, como es normal, irá complicándose mientras más avanzamos. Aún así, su dificultad no es demasiado elevada, y aunque moriremos en numerosas ocasiones, hay gran cantidad de puntos de control que nos permitirán seguir cerca de donde lo dejamos.

El control, jugado con mando, es realmente fabuloso y responde perfectamente a las órdenes dadas muy rápidamente, algo fundamental ya que muchas veces habrá que pasar por recobecos en poco tiempo mientras nos persigue algún monstruo marino o un artilugio mortal.

La duración del juego no es demasiado larga, unas 5-6 horas como mucho, y su rejugabilidad es bastante limitada, a no ser que volvamos a jugar por disfrutar de la música nuevamente mientras jugamos. Este aspecto es el más limitado del juego, pero la experiencia que te deja al acabarlo es muy positiva.

En resumen, Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians es una pequeña maravilla que sin duda encantará a todos los amantes de la buena música, los puzles y el arcade frenético. Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995349586', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1439137972}
review: Nach ca. 1,5 Std Spielzeit nehme ich mir die Freiheit ein Review zu schreiben. Beatbuddy ist eine sehr gelungene Mischung aus Musikspiel und Jump´n Run (oder Jump´n Swim?). Eine grafisch sehr liebevoll inszenierte Geschichte die uns die Welt der Beats führt. Die Steuerung ist sehr simpel gehalten und der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht sonderlich hoch aber das stört in keinster Weise, wodurch man das Spielerlebnis genießen kann. Die Story ist nett gemacht (möchte aber nicht spoilern). Der Soundtrack ist wahnsinnig gut (selbst wenn man musikgeschmacklich eigentlich anders orientiert ist). Falls im Sale unbedingt zugreifen! Auch den Vollpreis absolut wert. Wer sich nicht sicher ist sollte einfach die Demo zocken.

review:
Extremely easy to end up with a checkpoint that leaves you 100% stuck, which means you need to restart the level from the begining if you want to progress. author: {'steamid': '76561197993699776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1425791103}
review:
Gotta move with the rhythm!

Don't let the look fool you, this game is kinda tough! If you're good with timing your moves right, it may not be, but if you're a little impatient sometimes, it can turn into a really rough playthrough. That being said, it's a fun, challenging game with some cool little puzzles as a result. The story's not much to write home about, but the art style and music are the biggest highlights of this game. 

The developers managed to bring together a variety of musicians of all sorts (including Austin Wintory of Banner Saga and Journey fame), giving each level a nice, distinct beat to match the changing environments and increasing difficulty. Even more impressive is that the sound effects of the various objects in the game complement each song, making more challenging sections even more enjoyable as you experience the full form of the background track. 

The gameplay itself is pretty straightforward swimming about, grabbing objects to open doors, swiping at enemies to defeat them or to hit switches in the environment. However, much of it is interwoven with following the rhythm of certain obstacles to solve puzzles by fitting into enemy movements and/or creating openings in moving obstacles to roll with the flow to get further along. It's not hard to figure out, but getting it just right can take a few tries, and it's pretty clever design to match with the overall theme of music embedded in the game from the soundtrack to the land of Symphonia's own little mythos. 

If you want a lighthearted, charming experience, that doesn't over stay its welcome too long, I highly recommend checking this out. It's lots of fun, though I might recommend a controller. =)

review:

I'm not just talking about crashes and screen freezes here, i'm taking about bugs that force you to reset the entire level you are on and start all over!!!!! author: {'steamid': '76561198052763893', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1423201481}
review:
The world of beatbuddy is based upon elecroswingish music. Various elements of the world "play" different instruments and so the level environment progressively increases or decreases the music as you progress. To interact with certain elemtns you have to keep up with the rhythm and time your actions right. At times there are labyrinths and logic puzzles to be solved.

Despite a few bugs my playthrough suffered on, which seem never to be fixed but could be found on google and worked around, it is a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027141250', 'num_games_owned': 1727, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1422934578}
review:
This game looks like it could be a lot of fun, and it was fun at first, but eventually the puzzles became tedious rather than fun since you frequently have to navigate hazards with somewhat imprecise controls and the game ends up being fairly repetitive. It's not a terrible game, but it's starting to feel a bit like a chore to finish.

The biggest issues with the game however are the bugs. There have been several patches that have apparently fixed many of them, but I just ran into one that will require me to completely restart the level (the checkpoint save is bugged) and have to replay through several tedious puzzles again.

Until the developers actually properly fix the bugs so that players don't have to repeat already tedious sections of the game, I wouldn't recommend it at all, even if they're fixed I wouldn't recommend it at full price since it just wasn't that much fun for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1421417743}
review:
[h1]Thats the Spirit![/h1]

Also Beatbuddy ist aus meiner Sicht wohl eines der besseren Indies, die man hier auf Steam findet. Es ist nicht ganz eine Indie Perle, wie ich es gerne nenne aber nahe dran.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Gameplaytechnisch bietet das Spiel einen angenehmen Aufbau. Der Spieler und Beatbuddy lernen nach und nach ein paar kleinere Fähigkeiten und auch Abwechslung ist geboten. Jedoch können einzelne Passagen doch recht langwierig werden und etwas Eintönigkeit kommt auf. Jedes Level wird getauscht ob wir rumschwimmen oder mit dem Gefährt fahren. Die Rätsel sind durchaus machbar, manchmal musste ich ein wenig überlegen aber im Grunde sind sie eher einfach. Genau wie die Rätsel ist das Spiel relativ Casual gehalten: Gegner sind leicht zu erledigen und ich bin nicht oft gestorben, wobei dann auch die Checkpoints sehr angenehm gesetzt sind. Das Einzige, was man finden und sammeln kann, sind die Kristalle. Diese dienen aber nicht irgendwelchen Aufwertungen, sondern jeglich Freischaltungen von ein paar Bildern, wie das Spiel programmiert wurde. Waren auch nen paar lustige Bilder dabei ;)

[b]Story[/b]
Die Story ist eher mäßig bis schwach. Man wacht auf, trifft ein paar Charaktere (glaube 6 im ganzen Spiel) und es kommen nur wenig Dialoge. Die sind jedoch recht schlicht gehalten aber dennoch recht amüsant geschrieben. Aber die Story ist ja hier wieso nicht das Hauptaugenmerk.

[b]Musik[/b]
Die Musik ist wohl das Wichtigste an Beatbuddy. Viele Gegner und Gegenstäne im Spiel verursachen eigene Geräusche und dadurch kann man die Musik ein wenig kontrollieren. Zudem wechselt auch die Hauptmelodie des öfteren in den verschiedenen Kapiteln.

[b]Grafik[/b]
Die Grafik ist ungewöhnlich, gut und durch den "Zeichenstil" wirkt das Spiel wesentlich einladender und symphatischer.

[b]Fazit[/b] 
Leider ist Beatbuddy eher kurz geraten mit etwa 5 Stunden Spielzeit, man soll sogar laut Erfolg das Spiel innerhalb von 3 Stunden abschließen können. Dennoch macht die Musik Laune und man Beatbuddy wunderbar relaxt mit einem Controller vom Sofa/Bett aus spielen. Es ist trotz der kurzen Spielzeit ein lustiges Spiel gewesen und ich kann es nur empfehlen :)

Ich habe Beatbuddy durchgespielt und ein spoilerfreies und noch ausführlicheres Review auf meinen Youtube Kanal hochgeladen. Dort stelle ich generell mal gerne gute Indie Titel vor:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5kfu6sLpiI
Alternativ kannst du, wenn dir das Review gefallen hat, auch [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool]meiner Kuratorgruppe auf Steam[/url] folgen, um meine Reviews auch zu anderen Spielen zu bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044351423', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1421740678}
review: A very enjoyable Adventure-Puzzle game set underwater in a world of music and especially funk, swing and jazz, where everything moves to the beat. Enemies and puzzles are timed to the rhythm of the beat, creating some unique and enjoyable moments and game mechanics. The music is fantastic, the world is pretty and vibrant including some stylish character design and the game is light-hearted and great harmless fun. It is a casual, arcade-style game that does not take itself too seriously, yet there is a lot of content here, if not slightly repetitive in nature. Excellent game, one of my favourites so far. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130321496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1419947409}
review:
这游戏我觉得挺不错的，但是玩家评价不是很高……其实我觉得打个折还是可以买一个玩半天的。

本作是工作室花了4年时间做的节奏动作冒险游戏，主人公是一只蓝色的的软体动物，在类似海底的音乐世界里为保护世界和大Boss王子进行战斗。游戏过程主要是操纵主人公Beatbuddy 和潜水艇在6 个大关卡里穿梭，所谓的节奏元素也主要集中在移动和战斗方式上。每个大关都有一首主题BGM，而所有敌人和机关的运作都遵守着BGM的节奏，这一点是本作比较独特的地方。

优点：
[list]
    [*]画面。画风就是截图中的厚涂手绘风，应该可以算是颜色鲜艳、角色可爱。不同的场景有自己不同的主色调和特色，细节也非常丰富和生活化；角色们像果冻一样，感觉手感应该不错，出周边应该能火。
    [*]音乐。作为节奏游戏，音乐太差说不过去啊……本作的音乐是电子风，和整个游戏搭配的非常好；而且节奏感很强，不会让玩家在游戏过程中为此而卡关。本作的BGM已在美帝水果店上架，不过没有美帝水果店账号的只能望洋兴叹了……
P.S.现在已有原声DLC
    [*]解谜：本作的解谜不算很难，虽然会死个几次不过还算轻松，检查点的设置也相当贴心；谜题设置也算多样，而且主角也会随着剧情发展学到新能力，唯一的问题就是后期有点模式化，而且感觉难度变化不大，缺乏挑战性。
[/list]

缺点：
[list]
    [*]剧情。本作剧情流程不长，通关大约也就2-4小时，即使刷个全成就也就5h不到。剧情本身只能说是比没有强点，由于过场全是对话，所以对不仔细看动画的玩家而言就是各种过关……相信很多玩家到最后也就是知道王子是Boss，而且最后通关通的莫名其妙，虽然蛮搞笑的……
    [*]操作。虽然本作支持鼠标键盘+手柄，但不支持混合操作，因此实际上游戏过程相当难受（鼠标党表示手疼= =）；而且游戏中的各种操作也得顺着节奏走，偶尔会产生死活动不了 or 半天踩不到点的情况。
    [*]其它。本作说实话解谜的提示给的相对不足，笔者之前在第一大关卡关了，直到看了别的玩家的攻略才发现那关要坐潜水艇……另外，大部分差评里提到了严重的 Bug 问题，虽然我没碰到什么Bug，但是游戏有时候会出现卡慢现象。
[/list]

总体来说，我觉得本作是一个8分左右的休闲作品，也很推荐各位在打折的时候买来休闲一把；作为一个有卡有成就的游戏，各位也可以喜+1一下。P.S. 我觉得这游戏的背景挺好看的。

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 685, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1420163803}
review: Suprisingly solid game, with just a few problems that bring it down. First off, the main character and his friend are awesome. Little things like leaving him to stand still prompt him to choose one of multiple dance moves that align to the beat, are a nice touch. There is some awesome music and having gameplay and mechanics align with the music and beat are a new and inventive touch. Some of the middle levels lose the quality music and just seem like opera music that doesn't really fit the level and the gameplay doesn't rely as much on it which is disappointing. Also multiple different beats and songs per level would have been better than just one. Problems are a lack of difference as levels, as each one looks and feels the exact same. Another problem is the game uses the same few puzzle, enemies, and game mechanics for the entire game, leading to way too much repeition. There are also numerous reported bugs, some of which you must restart the entire level over again for, such as I had to, which can lead to 20-30 minutes of lost time. Seeing as how the game has been out a while not as many bugs should persist as you see reported on the message boards. The ending is anticlimactic. More of the game should have been spent platforming/fighting enemies etc as opposed to just breaking barriers which bouncers and moving gateway triggers. The levels are big and have multiple branching paths which can be confusing because you have to spend way too much time solving similar puzzles. Some levels such as running from something, or guiding the way for someone, break up the monotony, but are too few and far between. I would there would have been more of those different type of levels. Each level boils down to using the ship and the guy, each of which feels like the last time you used them. Still a fun game and inventive way to incorporate music into it all. Also there is the cuteness factor. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007021880', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1408477826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071113436', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1402769163}
review:
"Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians" is a sweet music and beat based game. 

The level of adorableness of this game is too damn high. So let's take it from the top.

The environment is underwater. The beautifully made areas are hand painted, and filled with rock formations, plants, and cute sea creatures. It is all very pleasing to the eye, and generally forces me to smile throughout the whole experience. Also, the environment is not motionless, it is all vibrant, pulsating, bouncing, and swinging to the soundtrack.

The main character is called Beat Buddy. It's a small, blue, bubbly creature with big eyes, and... earphones. Whenever you stop to figure out a puzzle, he floats in the water bouncing his head and swinging his arm, like a real DJ. Did I mention it is adorable?

The game is basically an action-adventure with loads of puzzles, all focused around the music playing in the background. Each obstacle, element, creature has it's own unique sound which always incorporates nicely with the music, creating a beautiful, energetic soundtrack. From jazzy oldschool sounds, through clubby electronic, and even funky-rocky sounds.

While you can solve any puzzle and go through any obstacle without even turning the sound on, listetning to the soundtrack gives you an advantage. The beat, the sounds actually give you small tips and clues, when and how you should move to go through a challenge effortlessly.

The puzzles slowly progress from absolutely obvious to very complicated. It requires logical thinking, timing, and a good ear.

For me, the game is very relaxing. As I traverse the underwater environment, searching for my friends, hoping to save them.. as I bounce, float, punch my way through complicated labyrinths, I feel myself unwind. The music, the soft but vibrant colours, the sweet personality and feel of the game have a wonderful, positive impact on my mood.

So if you would like something gentle, soothing, and adorable. Something that will make you smile, but will still challenge your gaming skills, try "Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians". And don't forget to wear good headphones or turn your speakers up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996082709', 'num_games_owned': 1133, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1421206824}
review:
DISCLAIMER: Although I give this a reccomendation, do NOT buy this game at full price. No reason to pay that ammount for what you get. Wait for a sale.

Overall? 7/10

If there weren't game breaking bugs, I would most certainly give it an 8/10. A great sidescrolling puzzle/adventure game in the spirit of Donkey Kong under water levels. It's not perfect, nor is it the most in-depth puzzle scroller I have played, however... It's a beautifully executed casual game. The music is enjoyable to listen to, and (in my opinion) doesn't make you want to gouge your eyes out after listening to it for 10 minutes.

A lot of the controls/environment effects are themed, of course, around the beat of the music... and timing according to that. Though I don't think it adds anything particularly "unique" to the game, they implemented it well... and it fits in with the world and story.

Pros:
-Very beautiful game, the hand drawn environments added to my enjoyment.
-It's really fun. When you aren't stuck with a bug.
-Not entirely unique, but it puts a good focus on timing your movements with the beat of the music.

Neutral:
-Controls are a little looser than I would like when interacting with objects, not enough to be a con.
-Puzzles, they aren't too hard.. and they arent too difficult. Very casual. This could be a con or a pro.

Cons:
-Game breaking bugs.

EDIT: This isnt accurately refelcting my played time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024345661', 'num_games_owned': 1372, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1415376826}
review:
Arkáda s rytmem. 

Beatbuddy má neotřelý námět a herní mechanismus. Nemůžu říct, že je to vyloženě špatná hra, ale  mě nesedla... Přitom to vypadá jako dobrý nápad. Jednotlivá kola se točí kolem jedné skladby a vy se budete točit taky, protože vám nic jiného nezbyde:-) Podle rytmu hudby se totiž pohybují nepřátelé a pasti. Tohle spojení přináší (ne)evidentní problém - pokud se vám nebude líbit styl hudby a to, že jedno kolo trvá kolem hodiny, neodnesete si úplně nejlepší dojem. Což se stalo mě. 

Beatbuddy je pořád celkem hezká hra. Ručně malované prostředí vypadá na nezávislý titul dost dobře a je vidět kolik práce do něj autoři vložili. Ovládání myší funguje celkem slušně, čas od času sice sednete do ponorky, která se pohybuje tak nějak těžkopádně, ale za tím bych viděl spíš záměr, než chybu. 

V recenzích si lidé čas od času stěžují na bugy, ale já si nevzpomínám, že bych na nějaký narazil. To už se mi častěji stalo, že jsem tak nějak nepochopil záměr autorů a nevěděl co dělat. 

Hru jsem měl rozehranou přes rok (mimochodem nedávno byl vydán patch, který vylepšil třeba menu - autoři se evidentně pořád snaží). Nakonec jsem se příměl se k ní vrátit a dohrát jí, ale nějak to nebylo ono. 

Za kolik stojí <2€

author: {'steamid': '76561197978009802', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1395244659}
review:
It's a great blend of electroswing and other wonderful music with an interesting combination of puzzle and action gameplay. The art style with its bright colors is also easy on the eyes, but the music certainly is the game's strongest point. I terribly suck at music games, but here I kept bobbing my head to the rhythm here out of sheer enjoyment of the tunes. This, of course, helps a lot in playing as you benefit from doing certain actions within a rhythm.
But anybody entirely unable of keeping a steady rhythm needs not to fret either, as the game is rather forgiving.

If I had to criticize anything, it would be the fact that it's entirely possible to miss collectibles on your first trip through a stage. Take the wrong turn, and you can't go back. Sure, that's a minor complaint, but for a completionist like myself, it can be a bit jarring as you need to replay a stage at least once to grab all trinkets and possibly once more to finish a stage in as little time as possible for the "beat the game in under x hours" achievement.

Also, the controls feel wonky at times, but you get used to it, and in no time you'll swiftly sway though the ocean.

Still, it's an overall wonderful and quite unique experience that's well worth trying out not only for its great style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993853495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1415048496}
review:
It's not an overall terrible game, but it is incredibly tedious. The puzzles are bland and after the first fifteen times you bounce off plants after aligning a couple drum-things, it gets rather boring. Plus I encountered game breaking bugs like when, during a chase scene in Chapter Two, I could not shoot through the pillars to escape the giant fish head. There was also the time my character disappeared from the screen entirely, and I had to restart the game. It does have a nice feature where, if your computer has changeable colored lights on the front, they will pulse and change color with the music and environment.

I did not finish this game, as I could not proceed past the aforementioned bug, and it was getting repetitive. Maybe the puzzles (and music) get more varied as you go on, but I don't feel compelled enough to find out.

C-
I felt this game had some interesting mechanics, but they weren't fleshed out enough. Plus, game stopping bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995554713', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1414972420}
review: Beatbuddy pairs great music and wonderful art with poor execution. I have encountered multiple bugs (Mac version) while playing and the controls can sometimes be a bit frustrating. The difficulty level swings abruptly between way too easy and maddeningly difficult pretty regularly, and it can sometimes be hard to tell if it's the software bugs or level design that causes it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077952116', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1406777457}
review: Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians ist ein sehr interessantes Spiel, was vor allem in Sachen Musik viel Unterhaltung bietet. Sollte man auf gute Beats und Abenteuer stehen und ein wenig Geduld mitbringen, dann ist dieses Spiel genau das richtige. Bei manchen Missionen muss man eventuell etwas nachdenken, aber man wird sich nicht zu lange daran aufhalten müssen. Die Geschichte zieht sich durch´s ganze Spiel und kann einem schöne Stunden bereiten. Jedoch hat Beatbuddy nicht an sich, die Spieler lange an sich zu halten. Sollte man darüber nachdenken das Spiel zu kaufen, so kann man sagen es bietet gute Unterhaltung. Jedoch muss man nicht unbedingt Geld dafür ausgeben, das Spiel ist kein muss!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055054505', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1409234094}
review:
Великолепная игра, которая стоит недешево для своего жанра (250 рублей), но во время распродаж (60 рублей) её берут многие в коллекцию и практически никто не запускает (лишь 29% людей прошли 1-й уровень, 3% дошли до 6го), а зря! Игра отличная. Смесь платформера (только в воде, поэтому надо не прыгать, а плыть) и головоломок (простеньких). В игре всё завязано на музыке - всё подчинено ритму мызки - поймаешь его и всё будет отлично. Первый уровень от необычности кажется шедевром 10 из 10. Но потом мало что меняется и игра приедается. Во время прохождения были технические проблемы на двух уровнях, из-за чего невозможно было пройти игру. Патч пришлось ждать около месяца, но в итоге разработчики всё починили.
8\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076626238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1409911459}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992089451', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1413126554}
review: Ich fange nun einfach mal an. Das Spiel Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians ist ein sehr schönes Spiel Es geht wie man erahnen kann um Musik. Der Sound ist perfekt am Takt des Spieles angepasst und bietet abwechslungsreicher hochklassige Elektro-Soundtracks. Als Grafik wird uns super schöne handgezeichnete Welten präsentiert und es ist sehr geschmeidig animiert und alles bewegt sich im Takt der Musik. Als negativ muss man dort anprangern das sich die Levelabschnitte zum Teil wiederholen. Die Rätsel sind ansprechend aber nicht zu schwer aber auch nicht zu leicht und es wird kontinuierlich langsam schwerer. Sollte man ein Part nicht schaffen bzw sterben wird man nicht zu weit zurück gesetzt. Also wer Rätselspiele mag und elektronische Musik der macht hier im spiel nichts falsch

author: {'steamid': '76561198025582477', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1412858519}
review: This is a mostly good game. I read some of the reviews while playing it, and for a while I disagreed. I have a lower end computer, and for most of the game the fps was fine, which worked for me. I loved the music, and at first worried that I would get sick of hearing the same song for upwards of 45 minutes or so, but it was always just fine, seeing as how it would always play differently depending where in the level you are. The songs are fantastic, no doubt about that. The problems with the game are all in the final level. Many of the puzzling elements are quite forgiving, and moving around each level is relaxing a majority of the time. Not so for the final level. It was buggy (I ran into three bugs within a half-hour), ridiculously hard (most puzzles in the game I cleared on the first or second try, for the final level the last puzzle took me twenty minutes alone), and the game wraps up in a cliched ridden and unsatisfying way. It could have been so much better, had it been anything like the previous levels. The worst part is, it leaves you on a sour note. The last level makes me bring the game from a 9/10 to a 6.5/10. I still suggest you play the game. Just set your BS tolerance on high for the final level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997381526', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1457815524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019157549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1393680324}
review:
(Linux Version reviewed)
For a game that advertises a great musical experience, it sure is devoid of music. “Beat Buddy” is actually an action-puzzle game, with a heavier emphasis on puzzles (and drums) than I was expecting. 

The production values are great, with slick, captivating graphics and smooth controls. But after an hour and a half of playing, I didn’t get to hear one song in the heavily-promoted soundtrack. All you’ll hear are drums and cymbals, with an occasional snippet of sampled music. Basically, you’re listening to a drum machine for hours on end, which I found so irritating that it killed the game for me.

It’s a shame that the “drum machine” aspect ruins the game, because it’s otherwise a decent-enough game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009838085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1411228603}
review:
I know how hard it is to create a good game and I want to say out loud that this game made many things fine, but there is also plenty of bad things. 
I especially like the idea of merging and developing the game mechanics together with other aspects of the game (here only with music). It is my ideal approach to game design. You should play this game to see it. 
On the other hand game isn´t fun. It is confusing in parts: beautiful paintings doesn´t show you your way through in some places. Although it is kind of easy it fails to learn you something about the environment: like that beautiful yellow crystals are bad. They looks like purple/pink one but these will kill you. I had it on my mind, but I thought: don´t be paranoid, just try it. New (and evil) things should be introduced more "spectacularly". 
Simply: play it to see new approach to game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994271178', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1411414954}
review:
Hallo Indie-Game Freunde!

Meine Review zu Gamebudy:

Allgemeines:
Ihr spielt in einer Unterwasserwelt, in der die Musik alles beherrscht. Euren Charakter seht ihr hierbei in "Super Mario"-Manier von der Seite. 

Grafik:
Oft zurecht gelobt. Die Grafik von Beatbuddy ist wunderschön designt und stimmungsvoll.

Die Musik:
Die Musik gefällt mir eigentlich recht gut. Leider habe ich das Gefühl das das eigentliche Konzept, nämlich durch die Musik dem Spiel einen Rhytmus zu geben leicht verfehlt wurde. Oft wir der Flow der Musik durch irgend ein dummes Rätsel unterbrochen.

Steuerung:
Habe ich in einigen Reviews als Minuspunkt gefunden. Ich selber bin mit der Steuerung sehr zufrieden. Man kann das Spiel auch einwandfrei mit einem Controller spielen.

Story:
Leider sehr öde. Die Story regt nicht wirklich zum spielen an. Es geht, wie so häufig um die Rettung der Welt.

Spielspaß:
Langzeitmotivation bietet das Spiel eher nicht. Dafür spiele ich es immer gerne wenn ich mal noch 20 Minuten Zeit habe. 

Pros&Cons:
+ Grafik
+ Steuerung
+ Spielspaß
- Konzept
- Story
- Schwierigkeitsgrad

FAQ:
Kann ich das Spiel mit Controller spielen?
- Ja!

Wie lange sitzt man an dem Spiel?
- Vielleicht 4 Stunden. Es hat 5 Level mit je 5 Kapiteln.

Was hast du gezahl?
- Ich hatte das Spiel in einem HumbleBundle. Ein guter Preis sind 2€.

Warum empfiehlst du das Spiel?
- Zum Einen: Die Entwickler sind schon sehr sympathisch. Sie haben ein paar Making-Of Bilder beigelegt und man merkt wie viel Herzblut in Beatbuddy steckt. Zum Zweiten: Es macht in kurzen schüben immer wieder Spaß. 

Fazit:
Beatbuddy ist ein klasse Spiel für zwischendurch. Aber der Metascore von 75/100 ist schon gerechtfertigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051801657', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1399060607}
review:
Nettes Spiel mit einer tollen Grundidee.

Ich würde es allerdings nur für einen Salepreis empfehlen, denn da Spiel ist relativ kurz und sonderlich viel Abwechslung bietet es auch nicht, also nach einer halben Stunde hat man das Meiste gesehen.

Das Rhythmus basierende Gameplay hätte noch deutlich mehr Potenzial gehabt.
Trotzdem ein kreatives Erstlingswerk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066720916', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1412270140}
review:
Não esperava muito deste jogo, mas depois de jogar por algumas horas já não conseguia mais parar.
Cenários coloridos com gráficos lindos, música (beatbox na maioria das vezes) divertida ao qual os "objetos" do cenário seguem o ritmo e jogabilidade agradável (principalmente pelo controle de xbox).
Mas como nada na vida são flores, encontrei muitos bugs...
* Após "morrer" em certos momentos me tornei invulnerável e a tela ficava em tons de vermelho;
* Após terminar um cenário com o submarino, a próxima fase foi iniciada comigo ainda dentro;
Entre outros...
Em todos os momentos de bug tive que voltar para o último checkpoint =/

Enfim, apesar dos pesares... Jogo bem divertido e super recomendo.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011969439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1515161703}

As a rather casual dexterity puzzler, this one fits the bill nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072012333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1410027853}
review: I want to like this game so much, awesome concept, fun music, but the gameplay just sucks. The levels go on for too long, making me sick of the song by the end of each level. The controls/level design feel sloppy/sluggish, there's no way to avoid bumping into stuff all the time, slowing down your progress and ruining the mood. The game also can't decide whether to focus on puzzles or platforming, neither of which are designed all that well. I could be asking too much, just finishing playing Rayman Origins, but this game just isn't well polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000524957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1409762097}
review:
Beatbuddy is sort of a platformer, except intead of platforming, you swim around a 2D space solving a variety of simple traversal puzzles.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
[*]Excellent dynamic soundtrack
[*]Charming writing
[*]Some nice 2D visuals
[/list]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list]
[*]Game scripting broke on multiple occasions, forcing me to restart the chapter from the level select menu. (Restarting from the last checkpoint wasn't sufficient.)
[*]Controls didn't always seem up to the gameplay tasks demanded
[/list]

On the whole, a nice surprise from the Humble Bundle, but perhaps not something worth seeking out on its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086912037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1409148419}
review:
Je viens d'acheter ce jeu via le Humble Indie Bundle 11. Au début, je n'en étais pas vraiment convaincu mais maintenant je remarque bien que le jeu en vaut la chandelle.

Le concept est, selon moi, très intéressant. Les niveaux sont rythmés et prenants, la patte graphique est ma foi plutôt jolie. Malheureusement, le gameplay n'est pas très innovant. Mais il se rattrape aisément grâce à ses mécaniques de jeu qui ne nous font plus lâcher le clavier.

Indépendant, amusant, prenant, voici les mots qui conviennent le mieux à ce bon jeu indé, un achat que je ne regrette pas !

author: {'steamid': '76561197975346768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1409026462}
review:
I wish I could select both yes/no. I will put down NO. NOT because the game is bad. NOT because it isn't fun. NOT because the graphics are pretty nifty. I am putting NO down because this game has TOO MANY GODDAMN BUGS! I've had to restart COUNTLESS levels because of the buggy game interaction. It's freakin' ridiculous. Like, at Chapter 4 of the hive, after narrowly escaping death, i get to the end point and... NOTHING HAPPENS?!??!?!?! What in the actual freight train is up with that?! I had to restart that whole chapter because of that. And, it's not the only chapter where this happens. When the game first introduces the option to turn on/off beats you get thrown into a world of fury with switches turning beats off and the beats NEVER TURNING BACK ON AGAIN. In my case... I had to restart the whole goddamn level, NOT just the chapter, but the WHOLE... DAMN... LEVEL...

It's enfuriating. But, once you get past that, it's a lot of fun and I'm still playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1408916213}
review:
I would really like to recommend Beatbuddy, but I just can't... at least, not fully. While it's got a lot going for it, I just can't get past how buggy it is. Although I did manage to complete it, it wasn't without some serious issues. Several times I got stuck in various ways that prevented further progress - sometimes it was a matter of a game event not triggering properly, and sometimes it was due to going some way the game wasn't expecting me to (apparently). I also encountered issues where the controls would just stop working for no reason. Restoring to the last checkpoint sometimes fixes the issue, but this is rarely the case. Most times, there is no choice but to start the level (or entire chapter) from scratch. Do you know how annoying it is to have 30-40 minutes of progress wiped out, have to start over again, and hope you don’t make the same game-breaking mistake again (whatever it was)? Let me tell you - it's really f%@*&g annoying. I ended up having to do that multiple times. And would you believe, as a final bug-ridden cherry on top, the very end of the game also glitched out on me as well? Well, believe it. So on top of all the other frustration I experienced just getting through the game, I didn’t even get to see the full conclusion of the story. 

Now, putting all of that aside, what’s actually good about Beatbuddy? Quite a bit, actually. The hand-drawn layered 2D graphics look great, the controls are responsive, the puzzles are generally well-designed, and the music is decent. And that’s a good thing, because the music plays a large part in the gameplay - the environment works in time with the beat of the music, requiring specific timing to pass obstacles or solve puzzles. The first couple of hours are great, as the basic mechanics are introduced. Unfortunately, it starts to lose its luster a little bit after that, as most of the subsequent puzzles are pretty much variations on things you’ve already done several times. So you might start to get tired of it after a while (or maybe I was just burned out from having to replay several areas). I would estimate the overall playtime to be somewhere around 4-6 hours.

Overall, the game is not bad, and I enjoyed it while it was working properly. The frustration from all of the technical issues I had just ended up being too much for me to give it a full recommendation. If you enjoy action/puzzle sidescrollers, music-themed games, and/or games with pretty 2D artwork, it’s definitely worth a look. Just be aware of the potential issues. I suppose it could very well be possible that you'd encounter no glitches at all… but I doubt it (several posts in the Steam forums seem to corroborate my experience). At the very least, don’t buy it at full price unless the developers hire more QA people and/or release a patch that fixes the game-breaking issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039388506', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1408854365}

review: Music is awesome. Gameplay wise, the controls are laggy and unresponsive. Also the game had tons of bugs for me. I really wanted to finish it. I got to the last level. But then the game bugged out (again) and controls stopped working no matter if I reloaded the checkpoint or the whole game. Honestly you are better off just buying the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043205724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1408549688}
review:
Игрушка просто шикарная, для людей любящих ритм! Замечены некоторые недоработки, но не в этом суть. 
Каждый уровень - новая песня, которая по мере прохождения, дополняется новым звуком. Продолжаете двигаться на бит-мобиле - продолжаете ритм, которое соответственно повышает настроение. Что не обрадовало - мало достижений. 
Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113594383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1409745125}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082571861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1408644796}
review: I can't recommend this game at full price.  Fun for the first couple levels, then gets tedious and repetitive.  Several level breaking bugs on the last couple levels of the game that require complete restarts, buggy controls (using xobx 360), final game breaking bug that doesn't fix even with restart on last level keeping me from being able to complete the story.  The soundtrack is good, along with the level backgrounds, and overall aesthetic but I found myself just trying to finish for the sake of finishing rather than because I was having fun.  Couple this with the numerous bugs I ran into and I can't justify $10.  Pick it up for $2-$3 or less to have a little fun.  Other than that save your money.  Mediocre at best.  3/5

review:
Beatbuddy : Tales of the Guardians est un jeu d'action-aventure se jouant à la Rayman : Origins ou Legends !

Dans ce jeu, vous incarnez Beatbuddy devant sauver une princesse (scénario de base !)

Ce jeu a juste énormément de potentiel !

Super jeu de plateforme/musique/rythme !

Les musiques sont supers, le jeu est fluide, les mécaniques de gameplays sont multiples et simples !

Si je devais noter Beatbuddy : Tales of the Guardians, je lui donnerai 14/20

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1408524418}
review:
An interesting platformer, with a novel-ish idea - building the platforming mechanics around the rhythm of the music. Most of the time, it works, although there are some boring stretches.
Also, the checkpoint system tries a bit too hard to be user friendly, and sometimes gets you into situations where you can't move on. As each level is segmented into 5 chapters, and you can restart them individually, it's not totally gamebreaking, but can be distressing.

All in all, I can recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037266539', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1408359138}
review:
Although lots of people think this puzzle game isn't hard at all and the music sometimes just become annoying while players stay in a scene for a long time, I would still recommend this game.
First of all, with the beat music here, I say the developer team has a good intention to make the undersea lively and they succeed. The scenes of undersea here aren't dark and quiet but lively and bright. The design of the stages with the concept of the beat sound from objects which are interative and those which aren't have their own styles.
Second, the puzzles here are simple. However, the standard about difficulty of puzzles is different based on players' different gaming experience and the experience they're seeking from thie game. To me, puzzle games don't have to be hard to challenge but simple to relax myself.So, in my opinion, if you don't want to beat it one day after playing several hours but just relax yourself by playing games, it's good for you, too.
Last but not least, the game will be around 2 bucks on sale, which is pretty cheap to get. If you're pretty sure that this game is your type or at least you won't hate this game, I would say it's worth the price with the hours you spend enjoying youself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100980379', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1408287922}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989078276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1394889132}
review:
Ein niedliches kleines Indiegame, dass mich wirklich unterhalten hat. Es war allerdings sehr kurz wie die meisten Indiegames, die ich kenne. Die Story war nicht erstklassig, aber in Ordnung. Die musikalische Untermalung insbesondere mit den Beats und Rhythmen, die man teilweise nutzen muss, empfand ich als wirklich innovativ. Die Steuerung ist allerdings gewöhnungsbedürftig.

Pros: 
- Grafik ist hübsch
- Leveldesign (wenngleich die Level unheimlich groß sind)
- Intro und Outro (diese "Sprache" fand ich super)
- Musik

Neutral:
- Story (war ok, aber nicht weltbewegend)
- Spielzeit (könnte länger sein, allerdings für ein Indiegame nicht unüblich)
- Steuerung*

Cons:
- Steuerung*

* Ich kann mich nicht endgültig entscheiden. Man schwimmt quasi in diesem Spiel wodurch die Steuerung verzögert ist und die Figur auch gerne mal im Beat noch einen letzten Schwung nach vorne macht, obwohl man sie schon nicht mehr bewegt. Einerseits ist das nervtötend und stört, weil es die Kontrolle verschlechtert. Andererseits passt es zur Athmosphäre und Umgebung des Spiels.

Fazit: Wer sich mit der Steuerung arrangieren kann und 2D-Scroller mag, darf ruhig zugreifen. Ich bin nicht der größte Anhänger dieses Genres und hatte trotzdem meinen Spaß. Insbesondere im Angebot kann man nicht viel falsch machen und man unterstützt einen deutschen Indie-Entwickler.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuevwB7xROk] Weitere Impressionen [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967625658', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1408650843}
review:
Ich hatte schonmal ein Video von Giga zu Beatbuddy gesehen, wurde wärmstens empfohlen und für Zweefuffzsch zugegriffen.
Beatbuddy spielt sich sehr smooth, tolles Gelegenheitsspiel für zwischendurch. Am besten zu vergleichen mit dem letzten Teil der Raymen Reihe, nur in Beatbuddy "schwimmen" wir quasi rum.
Die Musik, auch von bekannten Interpreten wie Parov Stelar, in Beatbuddy ist eine Mischung aus vorgefertigten Tracks Electro/Electroswing/Lounge und vielen Samples, die durch die verschiedenen Mechaniken/Monster/NPCs akutisch mit in die Melodie eingebunden werden. Da gibt es dann zum Beispiel die Snare-crabs - wie die klingen kann man sich denken oder wenn die Texte der NPCs erscheinen läuft ein, im Hintergrund passender, Beatbox. 
 
Ich bin kein großer Fan von Puzzleplattformern, aber Beatbuddy kann ich nur empfehlen - dazu muss man sagen das es genau meinen Musikgeschmack trifft. :) 

Durch die teilweise auch recht schweren Rätsel und der Tatsache, dass die Musik im Vordergrund steht bei diesem Spiel - muss man sich drauf einlassen - haben wir hier ein kleines Meisterwerk voller skurriler Charaktere. Kaufempehlung!
