review: Un gioco incentrato sul ritmo, molto belle le ambientazioni e i vari livelli, per esempio delle rocce in primo piano e altre nel background, rendono il tutto molto molto fico. I livelli sono vari e simili ad un puzzle game. Molto bello

author: {'steamid': '76561198080045733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1407632184}
review:
Un plataformas en un ambiente acuático en el cual el ritmo de la música se convierte en el factor identitario de este título.

No lo recomiendo por las siguientes cuestiones:
> La narración de la historia es mala. No llegas a implicarte.
> La música, que al principio puede sorprender y resultar interesante, en breve se convierte en monótona e incluso algo molesta, sobre todo si te atascas en una zona.
> La jugabilidad es frustrante. Al desarrollarse en un mundo acuático, nuestro personaje se "desliza" por la pantalla, por lo que la dificultad del juego radica en poder controlarlo.
> Los puzzles son muy, muy básicos. Al final todo se basa en romper barreras, encontrar un artilugio para abrir la puerta o encontrar el pasadizo adecuado. No los llamaría ni puzzles.

Lo único que me termina de llamar la atención es el aspecto visual.

Si después de todo esto decides adquirir el juego, te recomendaría que usaras un gamepad.
El uso ratón es desesperante y la experiencia mejora un poco si utilizas el gamepad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007746696', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1393734125}
review: Is it a rhythm game?  A platformer?  Technically neither, really. Imagine taking all the underwater Mario levels and putting in eletronica music with annoying movement, several glitches (some game-breaking), and a story you literally cannot care about.  What you have imagined is Beatbuddy.  You decide if you want to play that.

review: The art reminds me of Aquaria. It's a passable game. The best part is the music. Using a controller is better than the mouse. I didn't try keyboard. It's really easy to get caught on edges as you're trying to dash past the insta-kill guys so you'll have to replay the same bits several times before you can continue. I think the game tries to be a puzzle game, but there are no puzzles. It's more frustrating than fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999405918', 'num_games_owned': 1775, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1406920774}
review:
A nivel de escenarios y tal, el juego es precioso. Ese ambiente de fondo del mar, muy bonito.
La música está bastante bien. Es una especie de electronica pero está hecha por tios más o menos de renombre y se supone que se acompasa con cierta acciones, pero bueno, eso vamos a dejarlo de lado. La música mola.
El diseño de niveles se ve bastante currado y bien hecho. Son puzzles son de varios tipos y bueno, digamos que bien.
Pero...los controles son un horror (Yo jugue con mando la mayoria del juego, con teclado y ratón diria que era peor aun). Hay veces que responde mal, hay veces que vas contrareloj pero el bicho decide quedarse pegado a una pared, hay veces que de tu parte piden una precisión absoluta, pero es imposible precisar con un bicho que se mueve como quiere. No me entendais mal, se puede jugar, pero más de una y dos veces estareis frustrados porque el control no responde del todo bien.
Luego, la historia. Se supone que hay unos toques de humor y la cosa es muy desenfadada, eso le viene bien, porque es completamente random, ni le hacia caso realmente.

A pesar de sus puntos flacos, un juego bastante disfrutable. Yo me lo pasé en unas 6 horas, así que os da para varios dias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097909794', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1406563812}
review: 정말 재밌네요. 생각외로 조작이나 패턴이 간단한것 같지만 너무 어렵지도 않은 퍼즐을 잘 배치했습니다. 6개의 챕터가 있는데, 그 챕터별로 배경음악이 각각 매력이 넘치며 각종 주위 사물도 박자를 타는데 이게 아주 흥겹습니다. 저는 마우스로만 플레이 했습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961161813', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1406487588}
review:
Beatbuddy is a game that comes together musically, but in some gameplay areas falls short. For the first half hour roughly you'll learn what "Beat" can do and how the world works around him. There is some awkward, slightly whimsical story that surrounds everything but it's not always clear what is happening. 
Gameplay is derived from moving around fluidly while creatures and things in the world all move to a beat. This is where I say musically the game shines. At some points you get an almost Fantasia feeling as a selection of sea creatures all make their own music, animating to the beat of the tune for the environment.

The music itself is catchy and immersive. My favorite moments in the game was when I would transition from just playing as Beat to navigating the watercraft vehicle. When this transition occurs, the levels music transitions to a chorus of sorts, making the song pretty powerful.

Unfortunately with all the cool rythmn actions happening, this is where gameplay tends to become awkward or constricted. Often times you'll struggly to effeciently pick up the object you need without spamming the mouse button. It just isn't a clean action, and since it's used heavily, you'll have moments of pure frustration sadly.
Movement is fluid as I mentioned, which once you learn the small nuances is easily adaptable. I was able to navigate almost all regions with ease.

The overall game is good and worth a play certainly, if not just to experience the cool music and beautiful 2d art and subtle animations. They definitely maximized the use of Unity for this game and it shows nicely. The overall game will feel repetitive after Environment 3 imo, but it'll be an enjoyable experience nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972990074', 'num_games_owned': 3115, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1406495688}
review: If you play this game for about an hour, unfortunately you've already seen everything it has to offer. i'm still a few levels from the end but it is turning into a serious test of my patience to finish it up. Which is saying a lot because the game is supposedly only about 5-6 hours long. It's too bad because i was really into it at the beginning and then I realized that there just isn't a lot going on beneath the nice graphics, decent soundtrack, and a pretty promising core idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005463499', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1406141807}
review:
f I only judged it for the art and soundtrack, I'd give it 8 ou of 10, as the hand drawn scenarios are really beautiful and rich and the soundtrack has some really nice beats, but we also have to consider the gameplay and other aspects of the game, so, I'll stick with a 6.

First of all, there's the  story.
In terms of plot you don't really have that much to start with. 
You're in symphonia, a world moved by rythm and music, that is provided by 3 "buddies", that wake up when there's any sort of crysis, and you are one of them, then it all gets a bit boring, as you are thrown in the midst of a story without knowing anything about any of the characters, other than there's this bad guy that want's to steal the rythm to himself, and thats pretty much it.
No side quests, no background stories, no explanations, you just start swimming towards you objective, because the dialogues say so. 
the ending is quite disappointing, as the game ends as abruptly as it started, and there are no answers in the end, is just a sort of "and our heroes did the job, until the next time"
You get rewards if you catch all the gems hidden in each level, but it's mostly sketches and artwork, so You haven't that much replay value in it as for the moment you end the game, you have no remaining objectives or bonus levels that justify replaying the same levels from which you wanted to leave as soon as possible.
then there's my main problem with this title. The gameplay.
You play mostly as buddy, but there's also some parts of certain levels where you control a ship, and shoot bigger enemies. I'll focus on the parts you play "by feet" as that's most of the game.
It's not that the gameplay is bad, is just plain old repetitive.
At first, it may seem compelling - i had it on my wishlist for a while, and even tried out the demo first - , swiming in a wonderful underwater-like world, exploring every corner and noticing how everything works along with the beat of the soundtrack. 
And then... you realize you've been listening the same song over and over and over for the whole level, and the past 2 levels. 
And that you've been doing the same thing repeatedly for hours - find a key or a switch, carry it to a gate, smash some shells blocking the way, hitting enemies, and repeat the process minutes later as you'll find a new closed door. You have some cool puzzles, but it's mostly the same sequence i described above.
 You have to do things with the rythm and if you're playing for a relaxing time, you may end up getting frustrated with a parasite you have to hit in a musical order, that you miss because you pressed the button a second too early.
In the end is a fun game, that can get boring a little too fast if you're playing it for the story, but still has a beautiful artwork and interesting soundtrack.So I just finished this one, and I just got the urge to review it.
If I only judged it for the art and soundtrack, I'd give it 8 ou of 10, as the hand drawn scenarios are really beautiful and rich and the soundtrack has some really nice beats, but we also have to consider the gameplay and other aspects of the game, so, I'll stick with a 6.

In terms of plot you don't really have that much to start with.

No side quests, no background stories, no explanations, you just start swimming towards you objective, because the dialogues say so. 
the ending is quite disappointing, as the game ends as abruptly as it started, and there are no answers in the end, is just a sort of "and our heroes did the job, until the next time"

You get rewards if you catch all the gems hidden in each level, but it's mostly sketches and artwork, so You haven't that much replay value in it as for the moment you end the game, you have no remaining objectives or bonus levels that justify replaying the same levels from which you wanted to leave as soon as possible.
then there's my main problem with this title. The gameplay.

You play mostly as buddy, but there's also some parts of certain levels where you control a ship, and shoot bigger enemies. I'll focus on the parts you play "by feet" as that's most of the game.
It's not that the gameplay is bad, is just plain old repetitive.

At first, it may seem compelling - i had it on my wishlist for a while, and even tried out the demo first - , swiming in a wonderful underwater-like world, exploring every corner and noticing how everything works along with the beat of the soundtrack. 
And then... you realize you've been listening the same song over and over and over for the whole level, and the past 2 levels. 

And that you've been doing the same thing repeatedly for hours - find a key or a switch, carry it to a gate, smash some shells 
blocking the way, hitting enemies, and repeat the process minutes later as you'll find a new closed door. You have some cool puzzles, but it's mostly the same sequence i described above.
 
You have to do things with the rythm and if you're playing for a relaxing time, you may end up getting frustrated with a parasite you have to hit in a musical order, that you miss because you pressed the button a second too early.


In the end is a fun game, that can get boring a little too fast if you're playing it for the story, but still has a beautiful artwork and interesting soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048808158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1405409263}
review:
Aquaria: the Musical!

More words? Okay. It's a puzzle game about finding your way through labrynth-style caverns and dealing with various timing based boundaries as well as some enemies. It's not a bad game by any stretch but within the first hour you will have a very good idea as to whether it is "your jam". The artwork is absolutely sublime but the gameplay is excessively repetitive and the controls can be quite unwieldy at times. The vehicle sections are particularly obnoxious but are thankfully beaten by force alone.

I would not buy this game on it's own. If it's in a bundle or extremely cheap on sale and it sounds appealing then you should give it a shot. It's a short and unique game: with even a little bit of patience you can probably finish it in about four hours and not feel robbed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013882641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1405963178}
review:
Petit indie très sympa visuellement, mais surtout accrocheur niveau son. Vous vous baladez dans des niveaux (longs, voire même trop longs) où chaque détail fourni un son différent pour former des musiques diverses et variées tout au long de l'aventure.

L'idée est excellente, le jeu sympa, simplement dommage que ce soit un peu sous-exploité au final (les phases où on doit réellement faire attention au rythme qui nous entoure sont trop rares) et que le gameplay soit un peu trop redondant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101919114', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1432118136}
review: I bought this game from Humble Weekly Bundle but haven't try it, just buy that bundle for nothing. But then it collides up my friend wants me to try this game. So I just try this, and get disappointed as expected. My friend claimed this is rhythmic adventure game, probably like 140 I've been already playing, and claimed that this game is much better because it has storyline. In fact it's not. This game [b]just attempted[/b] to be rhythmic, see how when sign just appears up and some beats beat out there. But whenever you've controlling, your movement or such, nothing seems to follow that attempt to be beat. Everything is just like click, then fly there. (It's actually swim here, though) Puzzles? Nope, they aren't, they are not unique and, not even a puzzle I can say. Things are just screw up. Trust me, do not try this, it won't be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018161255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1388721594}
review:
이름에서 알 수 있듯이, 'Beat' 즉 비트가 중요한 액션 퍼즐 게임. 훌륭한 OST와 꼼꼼한 비주얼에 끌려서 구매 후 해보았는데 그 'Beat'가 양날의 검이 될 줄 누가 알았을까. 게임의 다양한 구간에서 퍼즐 풀이를 진행하거나 장애물을 통과하거나 하는 경우를 맞이하게 되는데, 그럴 때 역시도 박자를 잘 살려서 잘 이동해야한다. 이 이야기는 즉 게임 내내 적당한 리듬의 비트가 흐르고 좀 더 중요한 순간이 되면 그 비트의 음악이 커지며 분위기가 조성되는데, 그 비트를 잘 살려서 척척 진행하기가 쉽지 않다. 이런 점 때문에 이 게임의 난이도는 꽤 높게 느껴질 것이라 생각된다. 

 게임 자체의 개성을 잘 설계해서 좋은 노래와 그래픽 작업, 시스템을 구현해내었지만 오히려 그 개성이 한편으로는 장벽을 형성하지 않았나 하는 생각이 든다. 물론 플레이하기에 아주 어려운 정도는 아니지만 진행에 있어 수월하다거나 쉽다는 인상은 받기 힘들었다. Demo 버전이 Steam 상점에 준비되어 있으니 미리 해보고 뭔가 자신이 박자를 잘 탄다. 괜찮다 싶다면 게임 자체는 꼼꼼히 잘 만든 것으로 보여서 즐겁게 플레이할 수 있을 것 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014999513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1406490570}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030574963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1438174032}
review:
플레이 방식은 매우 간편하기 짝이없다.
마우스와 스페이스바만 있으면 플레이 할 수 있으며 기존의 무중력 플렛폼 게임과 비슷해 보이지만 이 게임을 돋보이게 만드는 요소는 바로 음악적 요소이다.
스테이지가 시작할때 해당 배경음의 작곡가와 곡명이 떠오르는데 이는 한 맵의 루트자체가 하나의 곡이라는 설명으로 볼 수가 있다.
실제로 플래이를 해보면 하나의 개체가 등장할때마다 하나의 트랙이 시작되는데 이것들이 많아지는 판일 수록 훨씬더 다양하고 흥이 넘치는 노래들이 흘러나온다.
또한 게임 전체에 리듬을 이용하여 장애물을 통화하거나 가속을 붙이는 방식으로 배경음으로만의 요소가 아닌 플레이에 필요한 하나의 공략법으로 음악을 사용한것이 더욱 참신하다.
결론은 해볼만하다. 즐겨보시라!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022742232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1402605878}
review:
Pros:
- Great soundtrack. You just can't stop your foot from tapping the floor while playing this game. I'm listening to Beatbuddy soundtrack even after finished the game
- Artwork looks very neat. Concept art and developer notes show us how much work you have to do for the beauty which Beatbuddy is.

Cons:
- Game is actually short. I don't know how long it takes to finish the game, but after you did you feel unpleased.
- Controls. I think best controls are with mouse only if your keyboard can't stand ghosting (for this game you often need to click 3 buttons at once). Mouse isn't great either, especially when you have to pick/drop an object...
- Big SnareMonsters or whatever they're called. Just hate those things. I got bumped by it many times by them. If you can avoid swimming with them, just do it or you'll get pissed.

Well, more cons than pros, but still I think this game is great and you should look forward into buying it when it comes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033780418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1631529189}
review:
[i]Музыка это жизнь, а жизнь это... игра?[/i]

Beatbuddy это игра состоящая на 100 % из музыки. Различные звуки издают враги, ловушки, а диалоги NPC вообще озвучены в стиле битбокса! Это поражает, это удивляет и из уст у тебя самопроизвольно вырывается слово "Вау!" 

Дизайн уровней и их прохождения неповторимы и, в прямом смысле слова головокружительны. Особенно неповторим тот момент, когда на сцене выступал этот принц и вверх подбрасывали не шляпы и цветы, а наушники! 

Кратко о сюжете. "Мелодия" пробуждает нас и говорит о том, что "принц Маэстро" украл симфонию и вследствие этого [strike]забабхает шикарный концерт[/strike], подчинит себе музыку и захватит в свою власть всех симфониан (жителей музыкального городка). Мы, разумеется,  должны его остановить. 

Вот почему то мне хочется поговорить о создателях игры. Три немецких студента зародились идеей создать музыко-игру и с 2009 года плотно принялись за её воплощение. И что мы видим в конечном итоге? А видим мы кучу наград, увеличение сотрудников и Intel в издателях.  

С момента прохождения, до её окончания игра вызывала у меня одни положительные эмоции. Некий релаксирующий тур по завораживающим локациям (чего стоил затонувший динозавр ухх).

В итоге мы видим уникальный проект, доведённый до своего фееричного завершения. Прекрасный пример того, что идеи всегда стоит доводить до конца!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108183039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1404807000}
review:
The game had potential as a music puzzle type but it just fell flat.

The game has good visuals with almost no glitches and has good game mechanics (with a mouse anyways). There are two different modes: 1 with a vehicle and one with you moving around which offers a good change of pace once in a while so you don't get bored.

However, the puzzles are simply get the key to the door with increasingly complicated ways and are not that challenging. The soundtrack had its moments but the same 10 second loop gets ANNOYING after a while. There is a story there with something about taking over the music or something but its so underdevoloped that you basically can skip all of it. Also, its very short (I took my time and beat it in 6 hours). There are collectibles but I just basically gave that up realizing that all it had were extras.

Overall, it had potential but it lacked a good amount of challange. As a simple way to pass the time, not bad but you can do better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087654471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1404518430}
review:
Che dire, potrebbe essere un gran bel gioco, ma presenta molti difetti e bug che a mio parere dovrebbero far abbassare il suo prezzo fino a 2 euro scarsi. 
Mi sento di sconsigliarlo per questi motivi:
- iniziando un livello a metà dall'ultimo salvataggio spesso l'intero puzzle di gioco si bugga, le conchiglie che vanno a ritmo si fermano così come tutti i mob del livello. Bisogna quindi ricominciare da capo il livello e diventa una rottura dopo poco tempo;
- considerati questi difetti che lo rendono ingiocabile, i produttori non lo hanno mai aggiornato a dovere con dei fix.
Non conpratelo al prezzo intero perchè non ne vale la pena, aspettate i saldi, anche se un gioco quasi ingiocabile non dovrebbe neanche esistere sul mercato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3933, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1405567120}
review:
EDIT:  Here is my amended review now that I beat the game (on Windows) - I left the original review at the bottom.

Turns out that Windows was the key to enjoying this game.  I loved the art style, the music was awesome, the level design was exceptionally well done especially considering how it could've been extremely easy to get lost (yet I never seemed to), the only issue I really had was the controls.  On the Mac side, the mouse controls were terrible and a 360 controller didn't function properly.  On the Windows side, everything worked great on the controller and it made the game enjoyable since the controls were so tight.  If you only have a Mac, avoid this game.  If you have a PC or dual boot (and have a good controller), it's absolutely worth a buy.


V.1 - I want to like this game.  The music seems cool, the art style is interesting and the concept is a fresh take on the genre, but technical problems (at least for the Mac version) are holding me back.  The game crashes more often than it runs and the menu navigates without fail via 360 controller, only to have none of the buttons work once actually in the game.  Mouse control feels supremely subpar compared to what a gamepad setup would allow.  I'll try this game again on the Windows side later, but as it stands now, I'd pass if on a Mac.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997615828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1403992459}
review: Beatbuddy è un esempio di come rendere la musica protagonista di un gioco. Sei livelli contraddistinti ognuno da un brano musicale in cui il giocatore con i movimenti del personaggio contribuisce a farla evolvere, anche attraverso l'ambiente circostante, creando così la colonna sonora. Non è solo questo però. C'è una storia, ci sono ostacoli da superare c'è un gameplay non troppo vario ma sempre bilanciato che tiene impegnati per 5-6 ore. Davvero originale e colorato da gustarsi un pò per volta con spensieratezza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038820904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1493919416}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021609267', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1403984735}
review:
Buona l'idea ma realizzata coi piedi, sono un amante del genere ma il gioco è super ripetitivo e noioso e a volte frustante nonostante non sia difficile. Ci ho giocato due volte e la prima mi stavo letteralemnte addormentado sulla tastiera, potevano fare tutto decisamente meglio a cominciare dalla poverta di ide nei puzzle....poi la musica il punto forza di questo gioco è sempre uguale c'e' una traccia sola per ogni livello i livelli sono 6 e durano 1 oretta circa...ascoltare lo stesso motivetto per un ora è da spararsi.
Voto 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007423439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1403652127}
review: Un petit jeu original à la jouabilité de merde et extrêmement chiant et répétitif. Le jeu est plutôt jolie, avec un bon travail sur le son évidemment. Si de prime abord l'histoire est original, il ne se passe finalement rien, elle permet juste de « créer » l'univers du jeu, avec un humour qui tombe à plat je trouve. A la moindre intervention d'un personnage, on ne rie pas, c'est juste emmerdant et on zappe pour pouvoir continuer notre progression, le scénario est parfaitement inintéressant. Le gameplay est très limité, on ne fait quasiment rien à part faire avancer notre personnage, en rythme, plus ou moins, déplacer des trucs pour rebondir, et se cogner/planter lamentablement dans le décor, sans parler des clics foireux pour les interactions. Du coup on rush pour finir le jeu et basta ! On y reviendra certainement pas au vu de la médiocrité du premier run. En bref, des qualités visuelle et sonore, encore que ça ne casse pas des briques, mais la jouabilité hasardeuse, la très grande répétitivité des niveaux, et l'ennuie profond, ne permet clairement pas du tout de le recommander.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125267531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1700402273}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044576100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1668662721}
review: I haven't played it for too long, but I can already say this game is amazing! The environment is beautiful and feels so alive since it is always a part of the music, which, is outstanding in itself as well as the way it fits the game. The characters all feel unique and the obstacles are all engaging enough to keep you interested. It's a well executed game and all you have to do is watch the trailer to get the need for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010284659', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1403627185}
review:
Con un diseño de niveles impecable, unos controles muy fluidos (yo lo he jugado con gamepad, eso si) y un apartado artístico precioso, Beatbuddy ha sido una grata sorpresa para mi. Es una joyita indie en forma de juego musical que no deberíais perderos.
Joder, sólo por la excelentísima banda sonora merece pillárselo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096294934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1403596281}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003878190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 833, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1403461121}
review:
-: bugy, blúdenie po úrovniach, bez MP, hracia doba, stereotyp, príbeh, zle umiestnené checkpointy, nuda

+: farebnosť prostredí, soundtrack, hlavná postava, ovládanie, animácie, pohyb

Verdikt: Beatbuddy je hrou, ktorá na pevnom disku veľmi dlho nezotrvá. Hlavným negatívom hry nie je hracia doba, ale stereotyp a bugy, ktoré znechutia postupne každú sekundu strávenú hraním tejto hry. Pre niektoré bugy je dokonca potrebné reštartovať úroveň a dúfať, že sa opätovne nevyskytnú, aby sa hra dala vôbec dohrať. Krátkosť hry ďalej zdôrazňuje aj absencia MP. Kladne sa dá hodnotiť celkom slušný soundtrack, jednoduché ovládanie a hlavná postavička spolu s jej animáciami. Celkovo je ale Beatbuddy sklamaním.

40%

author: {'steamid': '76561198067897770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1403677291}
review:
Beautiful art style, but as a game Beatbuddy is lacking. The movement is unique, but quite infuriating at times. Even though this is supposed to be a rhythm game, a lot of the player's movements do not sync in with the background music, especially when it concerns those nasty white octopus things.
I'd recommend this game to people with quite a lot of patience, and appreciate a game's aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104357765', 'num_games_owned': 1665, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1409431467}
review:
Très bon jeu qui joue très bien avec la musique, chaque élément du jeu étant un morceau de celle-ci.
Les personnages sont très sympa, l'histoire est toute jolie, la difficulté est pas trop dure ni trop facile mais bien dosée. Parfois un peu casse-tête mais toujours un grand plaisir à jouer. 
C'est un jeu que je conseille pour ceux qui aiment la musique, les jeux bien réalisés graphiquement et un peu d'humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002980751', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1402822279}
review: Winner of BEST YOUTH GAME at the German Game Awards 2014로 선정된 작품으로, 캐릭터가 상당히 아기자기하고 전체적으로 완성도가 높은 게임입니다. 특히 사운드에 특화된 게임인 만큼 플레이 하는 내내 리듬(?)을 탈 수 있습니다. 키보드 보다는 패드로 하시는걸 추천합니다. 둘다 해봤는데 패드가 낫더라구요. 난이도도 쉬운편이고, 가끔 헤매는 부분이 있긴 했지만, 다시 해보면 쉽게 풀립니다. 부록으로 스테이지 클리어 정도에 따라 제작모습이 담긴 사진이 공개되는데 이런 제작진의 고충을 챙겨보는것도 재미있는 요소입니다.눈과 귀가 즐거운 게임으로 수준 높은 인디겜이라고 평가하고 싶습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068275481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1460100850}
review: Fun underwater platformer with an awesome electroswing soundtrack. Not very challenging, but with a name like Beatbuddy you expect it to be about the music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072545540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1403299348}
review:
Beatbuddy es un juego de puzzles y acción -con componente musical en ocasiones aunque no tantas como parece insinuar- en el que manejamos una extraña criatura marina que debe rescatar a unas damiselas de las garras de un príncipe malvado.

Vaya por delante que lo más destacable del juego es el aspecto musical. Casi todo elemento del juego emite un sonido a tempo con la melodia del nivel correspondiente, lo que genera pasajes variables que no nos dejarán de sorprender. Los gráficos de los decorados son también de una calidad artística fuera de lo común, tanto que en conjunción con la música convierten a este juego en una obra de arte jugable. La jugabilidad se basa en puzzles y partes de acción en las que es muy importante moverse con sentido del ritmo para superar los obstáculos. Nada insalvable tampoco, es bastante accesible y está plagado de checkpoints, así que la mayor parte del juego será un bello paseo por parajes de fantasia y músicas hipnóticas. Algo bastante chulo es que si recogemos unas gemas que abundan en los niveles, desbloquearemos una cachonda galeria donde los programadores nos explican con mucho humor el largo y dur peregrinaje que supuso la creación del juego, incluyendo numerosos bocetos del desarrollo. De veras, valen la pena.

¿Lo peor de Beatbuddy? Pues que tiene un gameplay interesante, pero pronto se acaban las novedades y todo empieza a ser una repetición cíclica de los mismos elementos barajados con mas mala leche. No pasa nada, no es tan largo como para echar de menos muchas mas cosas, pero llega un momento en que nos damos cuenta de que la idea no da mas de sí. De todos modos su valor es ser una propuesta diferente, refrescante y muy cuidada, y siempre es preferible sorprenderse ante un videojuego desconocido que volver a disparar al barril amarillo para que exploten los soldados que encontrareis en el 50% de los juegos que salen hoy en día.

review: What starts as a slightly interesting game mechanic soon becomes tiresome, then irritating. Personally i found the first level to be a turn off immediately, taking about 30 mins to complete. One level was enough. I have no wish to play this again and would no recommend it to anyone. ( unless ofcourse you are into monotony, irritating sounds, dodgy controls and questionable level length)

author: {'steamid': '76561198126998213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1402851737}
review:
Beatbuddy has a lot going for him - the visuals of an underwater world are beautiful, the electro swing/house/jazzy music is great and the the main thing, puzzles, are fun too. 
What's not so great is that in order to solve those puzzles you need to move in rhythm with the music which is next to impossible. Even if you manage to click to the beat, the game reacts a split second later - and that is exactly a split second too late.
And worse than that, there are several level-breaking bugs that either force you to repeat a chapter and lose all your crystals or repeat the whole level.

All in all though, I played the game until the end and mostly had fun with it, that's why I decided to recommend it.
Pick it up in a sale and enjoy the music!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053428792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1403316673}

review:
I've always loved games that manage to integrate the soundtrack into the gameplay. The controls are a bit iffy at times as a result, but it's definitely a unique experience.
And the soundtrack is pretty rockin' too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001226220', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1393831497}
review:
On paper this game is amazing: a game set to the beat of music that is interactive, with different elements of the game contributing to the song? That sounds aweseome!
But in reality, the execution of this game is terrible at best. The music is great, the art style is amazing with 2D back and foregrounds mixed with 3D characters. The main feature that lets this game is exactly that, the game. The gameplay is sloppy and poorly executed, often you will find you must send input at an odd off-beat to the music, not exactly off-beat, but at a completely different timing. The levels within the game begin to become overly repetitive and mostly the music is never fully playing, with the small loops of songs only having one or two 'instruments' playing at any one time. This sort of dissociation with the environment creates a very unsatisfying experience, ending mostly in failure to complete a level in good time or simply a rage-quit.
Conclusively this is a great game, save for the gameplay elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982658491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1407304901}
review:
Want to know why you should play this game? Parov Stelar is track one in this music-based game.
Want to know why you should care about Parov Stelar? Google "catgroove", listen all the way through.
The trailer doesn't fully express how it feels to be in control while the beat plays out alongside.

The games biggest flaws are:
[list]
[*]Being short.
[*]Being repetitive after the 3rd chapter.
[*]The astoudingly horrible introductory cinematic. For your own sake, just skip it.
[/list]

Sadly, these are serious flaws. While I think Beatbuddy does deserve to be played, I would get it while on sale.

I'm sorry the game's title is so bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973535804', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1507471113}
review: Contrary to some negative reviews, I find this game quite pleasing with the premise of rhythm and beat ruling the game. Sure, it's not exactly a strict move-on-the-beat game like Audiosurf or DDR, but instead is an adventure in a world that was created by music. The fact you can move freely and miss the beats doesn't really ruin the experience for me - it is a free-movement game, of course. The world itself moves to its own rhythm and you can try to follow it, or not. Using mouse controls makes a world of difference to the experience in comparison to other schemes. The art style is vibrant, the music is fantastic and so far it's proven to be an experience worth experiencing. Good job to the developers and musicians on making a fun, yet incredibly groovy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016195124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1505780573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029291468', 'num_games_owned': 2018, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1403674776}
review: Необычайно красивый подводный мир который живёт по своим законам. Законам музыки и ритма. При казалось бы таком однообразном геймплее с несложными головоломками игра на протяжении всего времени удивляет, одну красивейщую локацию сменяет другая, на место одной мелодии приходит новая. Все живет в этой игре в гармонии. Однозначно могу сказать, что игра стоит своих денег и неплохо бы было докупить OST дабы закинуть себе в плеер.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054347147', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1402603287}
review:
Un juego simple, donde jugaremos con Beatbuddy, este extraño personaje, que nos llevara a dar una vuelta por curioso y bonito mundo.

El juego tiene una mecanica simple, consiste principalmente en rebotar con el propio personaje, para ir abriendonos camino y poder seguir avanzando, y resolver puzzles, bastante sencillos (en algunas ocasiones la mecanica cambia ligeramente).

El aspecto artistico del juego es muy bonito, con un raro "3D" en los personajes (no se si se puede considerar 3D) y graficos 2D con distintas capas, haciendo que el mundo cobre vida por si mismo.

La banda sonora es muy buena, es casi el principal motivo por el que adquirir, jugar y disfrutar el juego. Es mas, el propio juego la aprovecha muy bien, jugando con ella a placer, haciendo que muchos de nuestros actos hagan cambiar la musica.

El juego no dura mucho, pero lo suficiente para el dinero que cuesta. 
Si te guste este tipo de juegos, lo mas probable es que no te lamentes del dinero que cuesta, pero recomiendo mas comprarlo en oferta, ya que es una experiencia extraña, que puede gustarte o no.

En definitiva, el juego no esta mal si quieres jugar de vez en cuando y no pasartelo muy rapido (ya que si asi lo quieres, puede parecer muy repetitivo, tanto la musica como la propia jugabilidad). 

Un juego recomendado para pasar el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078807884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1403810945}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998629256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1393775115}
review:
Beatbuddy ist ein sehr hübsches, kleines Indie-Game, dass man gut nebenbei Mal spielen kann. Man vertieft sich in die Musik der verschiedenen Levelabschnitten und lässt sich in der farbenfrohen Welt treiben. Die Story und Charakteren sind sehr witzig gestaltet, jedoch ist es mit seiner Spieldauer von 5 bis 6 Stunden relativ kurz (aber das ist in dem Genre ja üblich).
Mein Fazit: Wenig Geld, viel Spaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984600345', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1396618507}
review:
Uno pensaria que este es un juegazo con unos graficos muy cuidados y una experiencia diferente y novedosa, no estaria en el error però si que fallaria en pensar que este es un buen juego, y lo siento porque queria que me gustase però no.


El arte es muy bueno, tiene una gran calidad, però se hace repetitivo. Siempre hay los mismos enemigos, a partir del nivel 2 o asi i hata el final no se ñaade ningun conpte nuevo. Quan aburrido es eso? Pues muy muy aburrido.

El juego pretende ser un arcade, però termina siendo un platformero que requeire controles precisos, cuando los controles dan pena, te frustrant porque dan la sensacion de estar controlando un airbus en lugar de un ser mitico que vivo bajo el agua.

Los puzzles son siempre iguales, i cuando no són mas que obtusos, sin explicaciones ni nada.

Lo mejor del juego és la musica, però cuando lelvas atascado en la misma seccion unos minutos i la seccion de la cancion se repite una y otra vez, solo quieres que termine y quiarte de en medio esa pesada cancion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016704238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1537700401}
review: Első gondolatom a játékról még játszatlanul az volt, hogy valami 2D-s pályákon átfutkosásos tömegjáték, egy-két fűszerrel. Ennek viszont teljesen az ellenkezőjét tapasztaltam az első 1 órában a vigyort a képemről nem lehetett letörölni, és a "kurva jó játék" szavak is kellően sokszor elhagyták a számat. Igaz, hogy 2 dimenziós és hogy viszonylag korlátolt a játékmenet, meg számomra nem egy bonyolult játék, de annyi jó ötletet valósítottak meg igényesen, annyira hangulatos és vidám. Külön említeném, a zenét, ugye ami a játék alapjáulo szolgál, hogy szerintem egy nagyon magas lécet ugrottak meg a készítők, le a kalappal (persze a stílust embere válogatja mindig). Imádom ezt a játékot, nagyon jól össze hozták. Biztos, hogy soha nem törlöm le.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120185569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1402081611}
review:
사운드 트랙이 단순한 배경음악이 아닌 게임에 직접적인 영향을 미치는 요소가 된다. 
배경음악의 타이밍에 맞춰서 움직이고 진행해야 한다. 게임을 진행하면서 볼 수 있는 심해의 모습도 아름답게 표현되어있다.
퍼즐요소가 있는 신나는 분위기의 어드벤쳐 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045186550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1402204647}
review: Really interesting concept and execution of a game. Very good time waster. Won't blow you away, but is unique enough to warrant multiple instances of play. 7/10 would highly reccommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075834041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1402071007}
review:
Идея этой игры и визуальное исполнение хорошее, но вот звуковое сопровождение ... Хоть оно и отражает геймплей, однако лишь оставляет желать лучшего. Скажем в Rayman это было сделано на качественно другом уровне: там и картинка малось приятней (это можно не учитывать, ведь Ubisoft её разрабатывали), и геймплей веселее, и музыка намного лучше; речь, помимо оформления всей игры Rayman, идёт о "музыкальных уровнях" - в них происходит всё то же, что и тут, но всё в разы лучше сделано. 
В принципе игра имеет право на существование: и картинка хороша, и идея. Однако исполнение монотонно, а в геймплей по ходу повествования чего-то нового не привносится, помимо мелочей, но настолько несущественных, что они в принципе не могут учитываться. Плаваете, собираете очередной кристал, ломаете стену из ракушек - и так всё время, разве что порой у вас есть "подводная лодка", а порой нужно уворачиваться от медуз и выстрелов врагов.
Если бы сделали каждый уровень с разным жанром музыки - было бы интересней. Такого можно было бы наворотить!
Итог такой: кому-то игра понравится, кому-то нет, а кто-то её пройдёт и забудет, словно страшный сон.
За идею, хотя можно поспорить о её "свежести", и графическую составляющую 4 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066158105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1493574544}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000939128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1401874597}
review:
Ce jeux me fesait très envie, mais malheureusement m'a déçu. Assez fort même.
Pour faire simple, le jeu est très tourné vers la musique, ou plus exactement un rythme qui épouse la basse de tous les morceaux de l'ost, mais ce n'est pas un jeu musicale à proprement parlé. Il s'agit au fond d'un jeu d'action aventure assez classique, avec juste une basse qui rythme le déclenchement de plusieurs type d'action. 
Le jeu repose sur un nombre de mécanique relativement faible, et qui en plus ne sont pas utilisées de manière fort variée. Càd qu'on se retrouvera presque toujours à déclancher la musique pour casser un mur avec les "boumboums" puis à orienter les mirroirs pour rebondir là où il faut.
C'est un brin caricaturé évidemment mais l'aventure est vraiment pas passionnante que ça soit au niveau énigme, avec un level design fort dirigiste, niveau action ou niveau rythme. C'est le prix d'avoir le cul coincé entre deux chaises je suppose, que dis-je, trois chaises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117014966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1401808699}
review:
Asi jsem nepochopil smysl hry. Prostě si plavete ve vodě, sbíráté krystaly a otvírát cestu dál, ale že by se jednalo o nějaké hádanky či puzzly to se říct nedá. Sice jsem projel jen první kolo, ale přijít na to, jak nějakou lokaci projít mi nezabralo ani půl minuty, takže nevím jaká je cílová skupna, ale viděl bych to tak obtížnostně na první stupeň základní školy. Mě to prostě moc nebavilo.
Hodnocení: 30/100.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971628333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1401861614}
review:
[b]Level breaking bugs and mediocre gameplay tarnish Beatbuddy's beautiful sights and sounds.[/b]

Beatbuddy's concept of fusing catchy music with puzzle/adventure gameplay is an appealing one. At first glance it looks like Beatbuddy does a good job of bringing that concept into reality. Unfortunately that just isn't so.

On the 3rd of 6 levels I ran into not one, but two different level breaking bugs that required a restart from the beginning of the stage. Exiting to the menu and continuing from last checkpoint did not fix either problem. I stopped playing the game after that. Normally I would persevere through these kind of issues but this brings up Beatbuddy's other fatal flaw: it's not fun to play.

At its core Beatbuddy is a pretty simple 2D exploration game. The environment moves to the music but your character does not. That detachment from the beat makes playing the game feel like any other average 2D adventure game. Couple that with collectable shards that are completely worthless unless you get every single one within a level (e.g., 411/412 won't cut it!) and you're in for a ho-hum experience.

Don't let Beatbuddy's snazzy soundtrack and visuals fool you; save yourself some time and money by just listening to the soundtrack on YouTube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097421013', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1424793520}
review:
[b]Плюсы[/b]
+саундтрек
+приятная спрайтовая графика

[b]Минусы[/b]
-скучно
-однообразно

Если кто-нибудь из старичков вспомнит допотопную игру Ecco The Dolphin, то сразу поймёт о чём будет геймплей. Beatbuddy целиком заимствует геймплей Ecco. Разница только в том, что геймплей сопровождается музыкально. Фишка вроде бы интересная, но не удержит за игрой долго. В основном процесс рутинный: найди предмет, который откроет вот этот завал, пройди здесь, убей два моба там, проскочи тут. С трудом заставил себя её пройти. К сожалению, оказалось скучно.

Единственно, что понравилось это саундтрек в целом. Особенно удивлён был услышать Sabrepulse. Поиграть стоит только ради звукового сопровождения. Он здесь отличный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008616290', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1415007383}
review:
[i][b]A shame games cannot be reviewed just for their art.[/i][/b][/i]

Beatbuddy is a 2D exploration game with the whole game universe based on Music. The presentation is really creative, and the art original. The worlds are varied (with the exception of enemies only two in the entire game...) the Musc is very enjoyable and the fact that it builds up as you explore further gives a really gratifying feeling.

However while the artsy part of the game is great, the "Game" part really doesn't keep up.
For starters the narator has a tendency to mimic DJ scratching when he speaks. While it is a very interesting idea the result of it are cutscenes that are painfully long because of him, delaying any sense of conclusion at each and every sentence. Thank god they appear only rarely in the game.
The whole game is underwater which makes it impossible to have granular control. You'll often find yourself restarting mutiple times parts where very precise tasks are required to be done in very little time. Furthermore as you don't gain short invulnerability when hit and enemies love to push you around when they hit you [i]will[/i] find yourself being bounced about to your inevitable death. This happenning quite often it is one of the main reason while you will start cursing the game for not being forgiving.
Level design is not very well thought out either, you will often find yourself trying to find out why you can't go there, if you are actually supposed to be there and stuck because you went somewhere you weren't supposed to be.
All these issues lead to a hot mess of frustration and anger, powerless against a game that punishes you for being to curious.
And it really is a shame that the actual gameplay is the worst part of the game, leaving what otherwise would've been a enjoyable experiment.

Even though BeatBuddy has the looks of a fun rythm/exploration game, it's faulty game mechanics and ill conceived levels put an swift end to any enjoyable experience. Therefore I cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067376120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1400857952}
review:
Beatbuddy is an interesting game with very pretty graphics. The sounds/songs in this game are pleasant and cool, and they play an important role considering the whole game. The more you have sense of rhythm, the more you'll enjoy the game or it should at least be easier then. I admit some parts were hard and annoying for me, because I couldn't time my moves right (hey, who doesn't like challenges?), but nevertheless I really enjoyed playing the game and would totally recommend it!

Buy it and go beat it with the beat ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1462659880}
review:
[b][u]-Quick Review-[/u][/b]
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians is a short indie game that has emphasis on music quality. The music style is closer to electric, beatbox, and dubstep.  (Sorry dubstep fans, I didn’t hear any wub wub wub) The gameplay itself was more focused on solving puzzles. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4u7hb9yM6ug
[b][u]-Detailed breakdown review-[/u][/b]
[b]Story:[/b] There are two cinematic throughout the game, the beginning video and ending video, you  are the character “beat” who has been awoken from his sleep and must save the other two guardians and go back to sleep. The guardians are the ones who create the music for the world, so it’s of the utmost importance that they all go back to sleep soon.

[b]Game Play:[/b] The game itself plays to the music, everything is done in rhythm, if you’re boosting, you need to do it in rhythm, if you’re hitting a parasite, it’s in rhythm. There are two “play modes” that you experience in the game, one in a “beatbuggie” where you’re in a vehicle that bounces along to the music on its own, the other is when you’re just swimming through the water as Beat.
As I indicated in my quick review, the game is quite focused on the music quality, and but to me the gameplay was focused on rather simple fun puzzles. I had been playing the game A Virus Named TOM for the past week, so the puzzles were very simple and relaxed compared to my earlier game.

[b]Achievements:[/b] First time playing through I got the majority of the achievements (this pleases me, I want to get through my indie games sometime this year) There are the notorious “speed run the game” and “collect all the things”  achievements, but as a whole most of the achievements you will earn simply by playing through the game once.

[b]Price:[/b] Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians costs $9.99, that’s a consistent price for indie games on steam apparently, I’d suggest waiting for a steam sale, or purchase the game in a humble bundle. I noticed there is also a demo you can download and test out. As always; if you’re really interested in getting a game, checking out a demo is always a smart way to go.
For me on my personal value system (price divided by time equals value) I only played 5 hours of the game until I had It completely beaten, I do intend to go back and try to get tougher achievements, however 5 hours of entertainment for $9.99 would be too hefty for me. For most other people though, that’s a perfectly reasonable price.

 [b]Conclusion:[/b] I really enjoyed this game, I found myself bobbing my head with the music as my character dodged with the music. I would recommend this game to anyone who really wants to play a game with A) Great music B) A beat-based music Game.

------Edits and updates------
Edit/Update May 26, 2015:
Added a link to my updated version of the review -- my YouTube video!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972651647', 'num_games_owned': 1545, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1396723276}
review:
This game is a swimmy platformer that excels at the gimmick of synchronizing environmental mechanics and hazards with the syncopation of the techno soundtrack. The music is great, the graphics are sharp and beautiful, and the engine is responsive with excellent player control. Other than the music gimmick it's a pretty run-of-the-mill platformer that doesn't seem to do anything other games in the genre haven't before. As such, I've played the first area twice and may never play more than that, but it was totally worth the price for just that brief experience. 

One of the hardest things to do is to meaningfully synchronize gameplay with music and Beatbuddy does it better than just about any other game. It's obviously a lovingly polished game made by lovers of dance music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000713888', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1399574177}
review:
Обнаружил эту игру среди демо-версий стима довольно давно. Демка очень понравилась. Музыка, окружение, работа с деталями. Все было очень круто. Потом игра пропала с радаров и я увидело её после релиза и сразу купил.

Первым делом плюсы: Игра очень красивая, интересное и реально клевое музыкальное сопровождение. Ты буквально чувствуешь, что мир игры движется под музыку и все подчиняется ей. Есть интересные уровни и не обычные головоломки. 

Из минусов: Проблема всех подобных игр, которые идут по формуле [красота + интересные фишки] (Например серия Trine, Capsized, Shank, Toki Tori 2 и т.п.) Игра вам должна ОЧЕНЬ понравится, чтоб вы прошли её до конца. Скорее всего вы бросите её после 2го уровня, когда большинство фишек уже показаны и начинаются головняки (сложные места, долгие и нужные блуждания, сбор камушков и т.п.). Монотонность геймплея частая проблема подобных проектов, тут уж ничего не поделаешь.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096318819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1399503231}
review:
While I found the trailer and reviews intriguing enough to try it, also given that I'm a fan of many music games and platformers I gave it a try. But my opinion is that too easy, the gameplay is way to repetitive only getting a bit interesting late game, and a lot of the difficulty, when it is there, is more due to annoying, imprecise/unpredictable controls, combined with high requirements exactly for precision. I tried both mouse and keyboard controls, both of which didn't work all that well.

I also got stuck a couple of times, one time where I had to restart the level, and others that fixed themselves ultimately.

That said, it is visually beautiful, music is so-so, story is a bit boring IMO. I DID play it until completion, but maybe after the second level it was more about finishing than having fun, and then the fun returned a bit because the puzzles changed towards the end. I would probably rate it 2/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003135243', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1399319191}
review:
A labyrint game. Enemies and enviroment moves to the beat. The music in the game plays differently depending on the monsters and objects in range. That was a cool feature for about a minute, but the result of it is that you only hear a bassdrum most of the time when you play, and almost never hear the entire tune with all instruments, which is a bit boring.

The gameplay itself mainly consists of finding the correct path and once in a while pressing a button to the beat and solve some simple puzzles where you spin bouncing things so you can bounce your way to the next path. The story is boring.

I thought I would like this game, since I often enjoy music games, but I didn't enjoy it at all. I have played about 2 hours of the game. It was very easy during this time. I will probably never play it again because it felt like a waste of time playing it.

review:
Whoa !  Eine Klasse für sich !  Dieses Kleinod ist wirklich ein Musterbeispiel dafür, wie Sound und Musik zu einem super "Game-Flow" beitragen können. Das Game wird sozusagen durch den Sound und die Musik getragen. Anfangs versucht man verkrampft das Muster in den Hindernissen zu erkennen, doch sobald man die Augen schließt und im Rhytmus der Musik die Tasten aktiviert läuft es wirklich wie von selbst. Ab dem vorletzten Level wird es dann doch arg happig, aber meisterbar. Hut ab und Daumen hoch. Unbedingt spielen.

PS: Den Soundtrack habe ich mir gerade gezogen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054806568', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1431058488}
review:
I enjoyed playing this game very much! So much that I am writing my first review about a game. 

This type of game is meant to make the player use the clever beats and rhythms the designers implemented to go along with the level environment. BE the Beatbuddy! The art was very pleasing to the eye and the color elements in each level had its own distinct flavor that added to the game's unique nature. When I thought the game showed everything it had, something would always surprise me and that's one of the things that kept the game interesting. 

I highly recommend it for those players who like games for their art, music, platformer and puzzle/problem solving elements a game offers. Great game. It kept me busy for some time. Don't zip through the levels, just take your time and really take in the hard work the makers put into it. Aside from art work and music, the puzzles were fun and there were parts that were quite challenging. 

Oh! One more thing of course. The extras that are given really make you appreciate the game that much more. It tells you the story of how they made the game. And as you play on and collect the pink shards, you get more extras and it was really neat seeing how the game progressed. Again great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065364681', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1402127009}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089007720', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1398600094}
review:
Beatbuddy is a really lovely little adventure game which combines good old platform/puzzle mechanics with a really cool rhythmic aspect that will keep you jigging along as you play.  It's been said a million times, but the soundtrack to this game is amazing (and I'll probably be buying it next chance I get).  The graphics and general atmosphere are really nice to look at, and it's clear that a great deal of care went into the game design.  The story isn't particularly groundbreaking; it's tongue-in-cheek, really, but the most important aspect of Beatbuddy is gameplay, which does not disappoint.  It is a rather short game, but the behind the scenes extras give it some replay value.

TLDR: It's short, but fun and pretty to look at with a great soundtrack.  Despite getting this game in a bundle, I would have gladly paid full price for it had I known how good it was.

EDIT: Thought I should add that I used a gamepad, and had no issues, didn't need to remap, etc.  Just worked straight out of the box, so to speak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112374007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1401067007}
review:
Great game for non-hardcore gamers, 
gameplay is not too difficult, but also not easy enough to be boring. 
The levels are beautifully designed and the dialogue and characters are really cute.
Of course the music is REALLY cool. 
Pretty good for its cheap price, i'd say it's a must buy if it's on sale. 
If you like games like spelunky and binding os isaac you'll probably like this game too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032897082', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1395605577}
review:
Gdy mowa o Beatbuddy, mowa o muzyce, zakręconych postaciach i.. jeszcze raz muzyce.
Jest wiele gier muzycznych na Steamie, niektóre są lepsze a niektóre gorsze ale Beatbuddy nie jest typową danceówką albo stepmanią, bo Beatbuddy to.. zręcznościówka.

Poruszamy się tytułowym Beatbuddym w rytm beatu jaki słyszymy z głośników, przeszukując podwodne meandry i szukając naszych siostrzyczek.

Gra się przyjemnie, muzyka wpada w ucho i jest bardzo mocną stroną gry, bez niej gry praktycznie nie ma. Gameplay jest typowo platformowo-zręcznościowy, płyniemy, robimy śruby, beczki, ot zwykłe podwodne harce. Czasami zdarzy nam się wsiąść do pojazdu który dla mnie jest dość nieporęczny ale może to tylko ja wybrzydzam, nie wiem :/

Czy polecam? Jeśli jest przecena a szukacie ciekawie zrobionej gry brać. Ja kupiłem w bundle'u i nie żałuję.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027826544', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1398458657}
review: Смешанные чувства. С одной стороны игра довольно милая: красочно выглядит, клёвый арт и дизайн объектов, геймплей (как это сейчас модно) напрямую связан с (неплохим, если нет аллергии на Ibiza) саундтреком. С другой - до уровня шедевра (Braid, Bastion, Limbo) явно недотягивает: бедновато как по части истории, так и геймплея (похожая ситуация с Insanely Twisted Shadow Planet). Сложность на уровне casual, но последний уровень зачем-то привносит изрядно головной боли. В целом игра небольшая, самое большее на 5-8 часов, при случае можно попробовать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039961528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1402325489}
review: Un petit jeu d'arcade très sympathique ou vous évoluez dans un monde sous-marin et en rythme. Votre personnage devra nager dans des endroits hostiles et trouver la sortie du labyrinthe en résolvant des énigmes. Graphiquement joli, le jeu se joue au clavier, la souris ou encore la manette. Un vrai coup de coeur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030735248', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1451544753}
review:
Rez is a rhythm-based game. This is not. 

I can only figure that this game is coasting on its "indies....support the indies!" status that tends to make people judge it less harshly. It reminds me of a less-fun version of Aquaria. In fact, I'd almost call it a blatant Aquaria knockoff.

I got it with one of those bundles that has mostly shovelware in it, though, so go figure. I would pass on this unless you like uninspired platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012412964', 'num_games_owned': 1881, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1397806453}
review: This is a really, really awesome game! I love it! Fancy music, endless beats and a great story. A must play and have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034270657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1394983630}
review:
Piękna (rysowane tła naprawdę robią wrażenie), odprężająca gra z przyjemną muzyką :)
Bardzo ciekawe połączenie gry muzycznej z platformerem (kążdy element otoczeni wydaje dźwięki i porusza się w ich rytmie)
Doskonała aby spędzić sobie godzinkę wieczorem nad jednym z 6-ciu poziomów.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032874697', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1472781744}
review: Just a relaxing game with a great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073309911', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1398349383}
review:
Beatbuddy is what the title says its got a Beat with rhythm and the main controls is by using the mouse . Often times , its frustrating when using the mouse but I understand  this is the best way . 

Often times the environment reacts by the beat of the soundtrack during that specific level and you have to follow the beat through various obsticles . Sadly I use quite little of it just to get through certain platforms . Beatbuddy is a cute little game with a story that I could not delve myself into cuz the characters literally beatbox when they talk and MY GOD i rather hear them Beatboxing then actually making dialog .  Overall , its a different kind of rhythm with platforming mechanics I give it 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023476291', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1394166748}
review:
(Originally posted March 6 2014)

Tried to give Beatbuddy a try tonight (no, that statement is not redundant), but gave up after about 10-15 minutes (and very little of that was spent actually "playing"). I got this in a recent Humble Bundle (I didn't buy this game specifically), and a music/rhythm action–adventure game isn't really my thing, but I thought I'd give it a try…

First off, this game is intended to be played with a gamepad (not mouse or keyboard), but gamepad support was…"not great", in my experience. Buttons on my Xbox 360 controller didn't map automatically, and try as I might, I couldn't GET them to map. I tried both mouse and keyboard controls, and they were both terrible.

As for the game itself, aside from an intro where the narrator was using such an annoying vocal affectation that it provoking me to feel an inclination towards physical violence… I'll just say that the gameplay wasn't my "thing". I might possibly have given it a bit longer had I actually been able to use my gamepad, but at this point my patience was wearing a bit thin. Too bad, Beatbuddy—no recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007275936', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1398256073}
review:
Für den Sale-Preis auf alle Fälle sein Geld wert. Ein origineller Indie-Titel, gerade für Musikliebhaber ein Muss. Hätte ich das in der Schule im Musikunterricht spielen können, hätte ich ihn nicht so schnell wie möglich abgewählt. xD

Ein ausführlicheres Review findet ihr auf meinem Kanal:
http://youtu.be/dR2mWcCH-hs

author: {'steamid': '76561198037550488', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1643900781}
review: Интересная игра) музыка отличная! Всем любителям Инди советую)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025153641', 'num_games_owned': 947, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1393597962}
review:
this game has nice music and looks good and the concept is really cool. You follow the music and go with the beat. It doesn't work out well. 

The best parts of the game are with the vehicle since the beat part of the game is actually working and the music is usually at full blast there. Till then you usually have to solve really dull puzzles. (Imagine doing mirror puzzles from Zelda, but you get those puzzles CONSTANTLY.) and when you're not in the vehicle part, the music is really really slow and just not there. You're expected to follow the beat, but the Beatbuddy thing doesn't really follow it at all. 

If this game could be JUST vehicle stuff, I'd be able to recommend it. It would be good enough. But as it is, even 2.50? I don't think so. It's too much dull work to get into the kind of good parts of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033263509', 'num_games_owned': 2923, 'num_reviews': 569, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1398004805}
review:
Ритм-аркада.  Мы  руководим  совершенно  безмозглым  слизняком-тянучкой,  который  плавает  в  морях  ритма  и  решает  несложные  головоломки,  попутно  убивая  каракатиц,  собирая  кристаллы  и  катаясь  в  скафандре.  Предоставленные  шесть  уровней  проходятся  быстро  и  без  особого  напряжения  головного  мозга,  оставляя  приятные,  но  не  яркие  воспоминания.

Плюсы:  отсутствуют.

Минусы:  иногда  залипает  камера.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071652151', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1397916975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013469422', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1397895048}
review:
처음에는 박자에 맞춰 진행하는 것이 흥미로웠다.
다만 뒤로갈 수록 그보다는 스토리에 비중을 두는게 많았다.
...스토리를 제대로 알 수 없는 나로서는(한글 미지원) 후반으로 갈 수록 지루한감이 있었다.
뭐... 4시간 정도만 투자하면 빨리 끝낼 수 있고 중도에 나오는 불 쏘는 달팽이 같은 녀석이 제일 빡치는 정도.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706064', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1682795971}
review:
This game is worth it for the soundtrack alone, but beyond that it's actually a great game in its own right. I won't lie this game has it's odd little problems, at one point I got stuck on some scenery and toward the end of the game some of the scenery actually started to disappear.

Beatbuddy is a rhythmic platform puzzle game... Of sorts. The thing is the game world is, presumably, underwater. So your character (and all others) swim, so it's not like you jump, making the platform part kind of moot. I say it's a rhythmic game because the entire world runs to a beat, each level has it's own song, sadly there aren't many levels. Within each level are several puzzles which, of course, you have to do to progress.

In honesty I think I spent most of this game just listening to the  soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041850057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1397591583}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982485711', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1397496398}
review: The game seemed fun for the first 3 levels but after that it all went downhill. The controls felt really weird through out the game and I never got the hang of driving the vehicle. I just rammed through everything. Few bugs here and there and bad design choises overall gave a bad impression. The art was okay mostly, but didn't strike as something I would remember. Though sometimes the art cluttered the screen so that I didn't see anything I was doing. Too much stuff going on on the screen. Characters were good, but not used much, so the story was very thin. Most of the time I wasn't sure what was going on. Level design didn't help when I was just pushing one way without knowing what I'm supposed to do next or where I'm going. The game just wasn't fun to play and the beat/music part felt sometimes superimposed. The soundtrack was good though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062074226', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1397268016}
review:
La musicalización del juego es buena, pero tanta repetición lo convierte en [b]tedioso[/b]. Es de admirar el diseño de los escenarios son excelentes. 
Pero los diseñadores se distrajeron de un aspecto importante, no volver el juego aburrido; emocionante el primer nivel, dos dimensiones, juego poco ocasional, pero se convierte repetitivo, lo mismo una y otra vez. La historia del juego tampoco te hace dar ganas de saber que pasará más adelante, además de un final que no es satisfactorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081136951', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1516990381}
review:
Such a good soundtrack! Every aspect of it bobbing to the beat of electroswing - what's not to love?!

The use of mouth beatboxing for the dialogue is a great touch too.

Only downer would be that it's one of those games you either find yourself tiring of quite quickly or you just find yourself playing for so long that there is a thick layer of dust covering your grey beard and you realise the whole of mankind has crumbled whilst you have been absorbed for years in the game.

Lovely.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991798487', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1396688656}
review:
В целом игра неплохая, есть интересные идеи, только некоторые моменты слишком затянуты да медузы частенько бесят, но всё же что-то меня заставило в неё доиграть.
После прохождения зашёл в допматериалы и вдруг выяснил, что это тот самый проект, участники которого с юмором в картинках описывали историю его создания.
Стоит брать только в бандле или на распродаже.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126810652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1478944310}
